title: stellar_blade
body:
A Korean action role-playing soulslike video game developed by Shift Up and published by Sony Interactive Entertainment. It was released for the [[Playstation 5|PS5]] on April 26, 2024. A PC port is scheduled to be release in the future.

title: tanikaze_d_kai_(kancolle)
body:
The alternative kai remodel of [[Tanikaze (kancolle)|]].

Most notable in the fact that her top goes from half covering her skirt to being a [[crop top]] that exposes her [[midriff]] and [[navel]]. Her bangs also change in style, with the middle part coming down her forehead rather than being parted to the side, and she gets larger [[machinery]].

title: long_riders!
body:
A "Japanese manga series written by Longriders, with art by [[Miyake Taishi]], which began serialization in Ichijinsha's shōnen manga magazine Comic Rex from 2012". [1]  A 12-episode anime adaptation by Actas aired ran from October 8, 2016 to February 5, 2017.

title: koby_(one_piece)
body:
[[One Piece]] character. Koby is initially an involuntary meek cabin boy of the [[Alvida (one piece)|]] pirates until he was rescued by [[Monkey D. Luffy]] at the beginning of his journey.

After the initial encounter, Kobe has joined the Marine and became a disciple of [[Monkey D. Garp]]. Eventually becoming the renowed member of the "SWORD" special force unit. Despite now being on the opposing sides, Koby and Luffy is still viewed each other as friends.

title: yakshi_statue_(meme)
body:
Meme originating from a post on reddit depicting a statue of a yakshi, a type of female nature spirit in [[Hindu mythology]], in the Los Angeles County Museum of Art. The meme involves drawing a character in a similar pose and outfit as that of the statue for a [[fine art parody]].

* !post #8502547: Origin of the meme

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Yakshini":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yakshini]

title: karin_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. The sniper of Millennium's [[Cleaning & Clearing (blue archive)|]]. Goes by the callsign "Zero-Two" (0-2). Her full name is Kakudate Karin

She is a [[dark-skinned female]] with [[very long hair|very long]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[black hair|black]] and [[purple hair]], [[yellow eyes]] with [[slit pupils]], and [[large breasts]]. For her default costume, she wears a [[maid]] outfit, with a [[black dress|black]] [[short dress|short]] [[pleated dress]], with [[puffy short sleeves]], with a [[white apron|white]] [[frilled apron]] with [[white gloves]], [[white pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[strappy heels]].

Her personal weapon is a [[Boys Anti Tank Rifle]].

Voiced by: [[Numakura Manami]]
Original artist: [[mx2j]]

title: toki_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]] and the fifth member of Millennium's SOF brigade, [[Cleaning & Clearing (blue archive)|]], and a member of the SPTF (Super Phenomenon Task Force). Her full name is Asuma Toki.

Her callsign is "Zero Four". She makes use of a powered and heavily-armed exoskeleton called "Abī-Ešuḫ".

She has a [[blue halo]], [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default hairstyle is [[french braid]]s and a [[single hair bun]] held with a [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon]].

Her regular outfit is a [[tactical maid]] outfit consisting of a [[maid headdress]], a [[bun cover]], an [[earpiece]], a [[blue bowtie]], a [[skirt set]] consisting of a [[black shirt]] with [[juliet sleeves]] and a [[black skirt|black]] [[layered skirt]] consisting of [[miniskirt]] worn over a [[long skirt]] with a [[huge bow|huge]] [[back bow]], a [[white apron|white]] [[maid apron]], a [[chest harness]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]], [[elbow gloves]], a [[black belt]] with multiple [[belt pouch|pouches]], a [[thigh holster]] and [[white thighhighs|white]] [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[thigh boots]].  Her personal weapon is based on the experimental [[H&K G11]] [[assault rifle]].

Voiced By: [[Ishikawa Yui]]
Original artist: [[DoReMi_(doremi4704)|]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #6608775: Default
* !post #6813998: [[Toki (bunny) (blue archive)|Bunny]]
* !asset #24637989: [[Toki (abi-eshuh) (blue archive)|Abi-Eshuh]]
* !asset #24637998: [[Toki (school uniform) (blue archive)|School Uniform]]

h4. External links

* "Blue Archive Wiki: Toki":[https://bluearchive.wiki/wiki/Toki]

title: gundam_(live_action)
body: An in-production live action [[Gundam]] film by [[Legendary Pictures]]. First announced back in 2018, in 2025 it was announced that Bandai Namco and Legendary had signed to co-finance the movie together. Currently doesn't have an official title.

title: beatrix_(ff9)
body: A character in [[Final Fantasy IX]]. She is the General of Alexandria, and is an extremely skilled knight and white mage. Thus, she is classed as a [[Paladin (final fantasy)|]]. Has an [[eyepatch]] and wields [[Save the Queen]].

title: paladin_(final_fantasy)
body: A class in the [[Final Fantasy]] series, characterized as being knights with high defense values capable of using basic healing magic. Its first appearance is for [[Cecil Harvey]]'s story-based class change in [[Final Fantasy IV]]. [[Final Fantasy IX]]'s [[Beatrix (ff9)|]] is also a Paladin, and is a playable class in both [[Final Fantasy XI]] and [[Final Fantasy XIV]].

title: fusoya
body: Playable character in [i][[Final Fantasy IV]][/i]. Known abroad as [b]FuSoYa[/b].

title: mahou_shoujo_no_karei_naru_yosei
body:
Title: The Life After Retirement of Magical Girls

Summary: Shijima who dreams of becoming a magical girl is admitted to the school of her dreams. However, she was assigned to the dormitory where the retired ex-magical girls live. The retired magical girls do not age, live forever, and have various regrets. Shijima's future is… !?
other_names: 魔法少女のカレイなる余生

title: shadow_dragon
body: A black dragon that [[Golbez]] summons during a story-important battle in [[Final Fantasy IV]], [spoiler]where [[Rydia (ff4)|]] returns to the party as an adult and summons the [[Mist Dragon]] to blow the Shadow Dragon away.[/spoiler]

title: yakumo_beni
body:
A [[VSPO!]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. Character designed by [[Mairo]]. 

Unlike other members who debuted as part of a team, she is a solo member. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]], [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her original outfit consists of a [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top]], [[black choker]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], and [[fishnet pantyhose]].

title: yakumo_beni_(3rd_costume)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[VSPO!]]'s [[Yakumo Beni]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/beni_yakumo/status/1638601699349897216].

Themed as "winter date" attire, it consists of a [[white sweater|white]], [[ribbed sweater|ribbed]], [[open-chest sweater]], with a [[brown coat]] and a [[purple skirt|purple]], [[frilled skirt|frilled]], [[miniskirt|mini]] [[cross-laced skirt|skirt]], with a [[cross-laced slit]]. Her earrings are replaced with [[pom pom earrings]] and nails become [[purple nails|purple]]. Possible accessories include a [[white hat]], a [[white scarf]] and [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit, she has her [[long hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]].

      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Columbia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]August 13[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Lupo[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]173 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]2 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A self-disciplined mercenary from Columbia working with Rhodes Island.

She is very strict about work, training, schedules and always ensures to be punctual. Once she came to Rhodes Island, Quartz started to make friends and enjoy hobbies such as cooking with [[Cutter (arknights)|]], reading comic books with [[Heavyrain (arknights)|]] and following fashion trends with [[Utage (arknights)|]].

Her motif is based on the gray wolf.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Aida Rikako]] (Japanese), Jen Zhang (Chinese), Elizabeth Maxwell (English), and Kim Yoon-chae (Korean). Her art designer is [[five-fall]].

h4. Apperance
* !post #8814948: Default
* !post #8814954: Elite II
* !post #8814929: [[quartz_(cover_mercenary)_(arknights)|Cover Mercenary]]

A design, usually in the background, mimicking the contour lines of topographic maps used to delineate altitude changes.

The lines on topographic maps.
"What is a Topographic Map? USGS":[https://www.usgs.gov/faqs/what-a-topographic-map#:~:text=The%20distinctive%20characteristic%20of%20a%20topographic%20map%20is,reference%20surface%2C%20which%20is%20usually%20mean%20sea%20level.]

title: mortis_(bang_dream!)
body:
Pseudonym and alternate personality of [[Wakaba Mutsumi]] when performing for [[Ave Mujica (bang dream!)|]].

In episode 3 of [[BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!!|Ave Mujica]], [spoilers]Mortis is introduced as an alternate personality of Mutsumi, who is revealed to have "Disassociative Identity Disorder":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dissociative_identity_disorder], as Mortis takes control of Mutsumi's body while Mutsumi is, in her words, "asleep". Compared to Mutsumi, Mortis is characterized as more extroverted and childish, and is also prone to more outward and often theatrical expressions of her emotions, as well as copying other's behaviors.[/spoilers]

h4. Appearance
* !post #8506664
* !post #8655564

h4. See also
* pool #24582 - For depictions of the alternate "Mortis" personality in casual clothes
* [[Mortis (doll) (Bang Dream!)|Mortis (doll)]]
* [[Kenkou ni yoku nai! (bang_dream!)|]]

h4. External links
* "Character page":https://anime.bang-dream.com/avemujica/character/mutsumi/

title: takanashi_kiara
body:
A [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive English]] and a member of its first generation holoMyth. Designed by [[huke]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair]] with a [[green hair|green]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[colored inner hair|on the inside]], [[purple eyes]] and [[medium breasts]]. Her default hairstyle has [[hair flaps]] and [[swept bangs]]. She has clusters of [[green feathers]], which are often mistaken for [[feather earrings]], sprouting from just behind her ears.

body:

h4#sfx. SFX

h5#ta.ta:

[table]
[thead]
[tr]
[th]Romaji[/th]
[th]Katakana[/th]
[th]Hiragana[/th]
[th]English[/th]
[th]Explanation[/th]
[/tr]
[/thead]
[tbody]
[tr]
[td]ta[/td]
[td]タッ[/td]
[td]たっ[/td]
[td](1) *run* *step* *tap* *da*;
(2) *jump*[/td]
[td](1) SFX for footsteps when running.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]ta-[/td]
[td]ター[/td]
[td]たー[/td]
[td]*dashing* *running*[/td]
[td]See also *da*, *dododo*, and *tatata*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]ta-[/td]
[td]ター！[/td]
[td]たー！[/td]
[td]*roar!*
*haaaahhh!!*[/td]
[td]War-cry[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]tabi tabi[/td]
[td]タビタビ[/td]
[td]たびたび[/td]
[td]*often* *repeatedly*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]tama tama[/td]
[td]タマタマ[/td]
[td]たまたま[/td]
[td]*occasionally*[/td]
[td]Derived from the adverb "occasionally" or 「たまに」.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]tan[/td]
[td]タン[/td]
[td]たん[/td]
[td](1) *tap*;
(2) *lands*[/td]
[td](1) Like in tap-dancing.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]tan[/td]
[td]タンッ[/td]
[td]たんっ[/td]
[td]*thunk* *thok*[/td]
[td]A lighter form of *thud*.  A muffled sound of impact.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]tanomo[/td]
[td]タノモーッ[/td]
[td]たのもーっ[/td]
[td]*PLEASE WAIT!!*
*FORGIVE THE INTRUSION!*[/td]
[td]It's a heavily-accented "tanomu" or "頼む".
To request; to beg; to ask.
To call; to order; to reserve.
[br]
The humor might be lost in translation.  It's like "PUHLEAASSE" but emphasized in a very humble, cute, funny way.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]tappuri[/td]
[td]タップリ[/td]
[td]たっぷり[/td]
[td]*plenty* 
*enough*
*full*
*a lot*
*rich*[/td]
[td]Ex: "Plenty of time"
Ex: "Pan full of water"
Ex: "Enough confidence to do a speech"
Ex: Someone wearing more than enough clothing (i.e. a huge jacket in the middle of summer)[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]tapu[/td]
[td]タプ[/td]
[td]たぷ[/td]
[td](1) *jiggle* *wiggle* *shake* *tremble*;
(2) *squish* *squish squish*;[/td]
[td](1) From the word tappuri, or a softer version of tabu tabu: to fill up, to be full, stuffed;
(2) Describes the adding layers of skin.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]tapun[/td]
[td]タプン[/td]
[td]たぷん[/td]
[td]*jiggle*[/td]
[td](1) Variation of tayun
(2) (Best guess) quick movement [ta] + firm bounce [pun].[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]tara tara[/td]
[td]タラタラ[/td]
[td]たらたら[/td]
[td]*sweating*[/td]
[td]SFX for perspiration.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]tarari rari-[/td]
[td]タラリラリー[/td]
[td]たらりらりー[/td]
[td]*tweedle dee*[/td]
[td]Enjoying sound of music-making, like a violinist playing something.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]tatata[/td]
[td]タタタ[/td]
[td]たたた[/td]
[td](1) *running lightly*
*fast pace*
*quickly*
*fast walk*;
(2) *tap tap tap* *step step step*;
(3) *scuttling*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]tattatta[/td]
[td]タッタッタッ[/td]
[td]たったったっ[/td]
[td]*tap tap tap* 
*thud thud* 
*jog jog*
*trot trot*[/td]
[td]SFX for jogging or running.[/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

[td]To move around fussily, especially around the house.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]totechiteta[/td]
[td]トテチテタ[/td]
[td]とてちてた[/td]
[td]*blare* *trump* *tootle* *tralala* 
*rootle-tootle*[/td]
[td]SFX for the sound of a trumpet in the context of an army on the march.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]toto[/td]
[td]トト[/td]
[td]とと[/td]
[td]*strumming* *twanging* *plucking*[/td]
[td]A musical, beat-like, melodic sound - like a guitar.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]tototo[/td]
[td]トトト[/td]
[td]ととと[/td]
[td]*walking*[/td]
[td]See also *teku* and *toko*.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]tottotto[/td]
[td]トットット[/td]
[td]とっとっと[/td]
[td]*trot trot trot* 
*tap tap tap*[/td]
[td][/td]
[/tr]
[/tbody]
[/table]

title: minato_yukina
body:
The vocalist of [[roselia_(bang_dream!)|Roselia]] in [[BanG Dream!]]. She has [[long_hair|long]] [[light purple hair]] and [[yellow eyes]].

Minato Yukina is a perfectionist with a seemingly-cold personality who has fully devoted herself to music; however, she has a secret soft side and loves cats. She is childhood friends with bandmate [[Imai Lisa]]. Her birthday is October 26th, and her seiyuu is [[Aiba Aina]].

title: imai_lisa
body:
The bassist of [[roselia_(bang_dream!)|Roselia]] in [[BanG Dream!]]. She is a second-year high school student with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]], [[green eyes]] and a [[:3]] smile. Her interests include [[gyaru]] fashion and [[amigurumi (medium)|]].

Lisa is childhood friends with bandmate [[Minato Yukina]], and friends with [[Aoba Moca]], who works with her at a convenience store.

Her birthday is August 25th.

Originally, her seiyuu was [[Endou Yurika]]. When Endou Yurika retired from the entertainment industry in 2018, [[Nakashima Yuki]] (who also has a [[:3]] smile) became her seiyuu.

title: hato_moa
body: Artist, illustrator, mangaka. Best known as the creator of [[Hatoful Kareshi]].

title: hatoful_kareshi
body:
Japanese title: はーとふる彼氏 ~希望の学園と白い翼~ ([i]Hātoful[Haatoful] Kareshi: Kibou no Gakuen to Shiroi Tsubasa[/i])
English version title: Hatoful Boyfriend

Translates into [i]Pigeon Boyfriend[/i]. Created by [[Hato Moa]]. An otome game wherein the player takes on the role of [[Tousaka Hiyoko]], a girl who attends a school consisting entirely of birds. A demo was released in 2011 by doujin circle PigeoNation Inc. and the full game was released in 2012 with an English version, and a high-definition remake was released in 2014.

body: The second [[Mario Tennis]] game, released in 2000 on the [[Nintendo 64]]. It is the first to be developed by Camelot Software Planning, who would become the main developer of the series.

title: body_modification
body:
When a character's body or body parts is altered in some way that their functionality is improved or altered, such as increased muscle mass or an addition of cybernetic parts.

Commonly seen in the namesake fetish where a character's body was modified into a "living sex toy/onahole".

h4. See also
* [[amputee]]
* [[breast expansion]]
* [[cyborg]]

title: gambling
body:
To play a game of chance for money or other stakes. A person will risk money or other items of value to play a game of luck and chance, hoping that they will win and earn money/items of higher value than what was risked.

Various games are designed for gambling purposes, and an institution that employs people to deal in these games are called [[casino|casinos]].

h4.See also

* [[pachinko]]
* [[playing card]]
* [[poker chip]]
* [[roulette table]]
* [[slot machine]]

title: pachinko
body:
A Japanese [[gambling]] game machine similar to [[pinball]], but with several pegs and catchers, enabling players to win more [[pachinko ball]]s for later play and/or in exchange for prizes. Some pachinko machines have digital [[slot machine]]s to multiply winnings.

h4. Further reading:
* "Wikipedia: Pachinko":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pachinko]

title: slot_machine
body:
A coin-operated gaming/[[gambling]] machine that generates random combinations of symbols on a dial, certain combinations winning varying amounts of money for the player. The jackpot combination is usually [[777]].

h4. See also
* [[Pachinko]]

title: amiba
body:
[b]Amiba[/b] is a minor villain from [[Hokuto no Ken]]. He is an impostor of [[Toki (hokuto no ken)|]] who took on his name after the latter was imprisoned by [[Raoh (hokuto no ken)|]]'s forces. He then used Toki's fame as a doctor to extort wastelander to "cure" their illness with his botched imitation of Toki's [i]Hokuto Uchou Ken[/i] technique.

He has gained recurring memetic popularity in Japan due to a series of reader's fanfics on the magazine [[Fanroad]] that involves him appeared in various other anime he is completely unrelated to.

title: fanroad
body:
A Japanese anime and entertainment magazine. It uses a [[platypus]] as its [[mascot]] character.
Since its first issue in 1980, it has gone through cancellation, revival and a change of name and publishing company. However, throughout all this, "Hamamatsu Katsuki":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B5%9C%E6%9D%BE%E5%85%8B%E6%A8%B9] has remained the chief editor. He is also known by the pen name " 'K' of Initial Biscuit", and is famous for creating the word [[kaneda_shoutarou_(tetsujin_28-gou)|Shoutarou]] complex, the origin of the Japanese slang word "[[shota|shotakon]]".

This magazine is known for its bunch of "From Readers" pages packed with weird parodies, a few of which still survive today as [[meme|memes]].
The most famous of these running gags is the following: [[Amiba]] from [[Hokuto no Ken]] appears in fanmade anime/manga dictionaries that are completely unrelated to him, and schemes to steal the glory of the top entry in the "gojuuon kana ordering":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Goj%C5%ABon] list. However, he fails every time.
In addition, hardcore readers have their own jargon they use frequently. The most popular of these is "Roadists", the name they call themselves, and "gegebo", which means "to be astonished by incredibly, wretchedly, pathetic things."

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article (JP)":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%83%95%E3%82%A1%E3%83%B3%E3%83%AD%E3%83%BC%E3%83%89]

title: kagerou_project
body:
The [b]Kagerou Project[/b] is a series of songs by the [[Vocaloid]] song producer Shizen no Teki-P, or "Jin":[https://vocaloid.fandom.com/wiki/Jin]. There have been twelve songs uploaded to [[NicoNico|Nico Nico Douga]] and four songs exclusively for the album Mechanical City Days. A light novel series, titled [i]Kagerou Days[/i], was released and lasted for 13 volumes. A manga by the same name was published monthly on Comic Gene, illustrated by "Satou Mahiro":[https://kagerouproject.fandom.com/wiki/Mahiro_Satou]. An anime adaption by [[Shaft (company)|]] premiered in April 2014 titled "[[Mekakucity Actors]]", with a movie adaptation in 2016 called "Kagerou Daze -in a day's-".

title: jun'you_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light carrier [i]Jun'you[/i]. Character design by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] feathered-[[spiked_hair|spiked]] [[purple hair]], [[purple eyes]], [[large breasts]], and her flame color is purple.

Her uniform is similar to her sister Hiyou's: a white-red [[blouse]] over a [[red shirt|red]] [[dress shirt]], [[magatama]], [[red pants|red]] [[hakama pants]], and [[platform footwear]]. For their flight decks, they both use [[scroll|scrolls]], the airplanes are [[shikigami]], controlling them as [[onmyouji]]. They also emit colored flames with text reading "Imperial Edict".

Considered to be the "Hard Drinking Party Girl":http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HardDrinkingPartyGirl of the game and one of the drunkards in the fleet. Her catchphrase (and nickname) is "[i][b]Hyahaaah![/b][/i]", which sounds like what random outlaws in [[Hokuto no Ken]] would say.  Because of this, she is sometimes referred to as the "End of the Century Carrier".

title: hiyou_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light carrier [i]Hiyou[/i]. Character design by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] in a [[hime cut]] with [[hair_ribbon|hair ribbons]], [[purple eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. Her hakama is cut as a skirt and her flame color is pink.

Her uniform consists of a white [[blouse]] with red trimmings over a red [[dress shirt]] for the top, reminiscing their past as army-subsidized ocean liners, and a [[magatama]]. The bottom is a wide red [[hakama skirt]] trimmed to calf-length. They wear platform shoes. For their flight decks, they both use [[scroll|scrolls]], the airplanes are [[shikigami]], controlling them as [[onmyouji]]. They also emit colored flames with text reading "Imperial Edict".

title: chemistry
body:
A branch of [[science]] involving the composition, properties, and behaviors of physical matter. Most prominent in the field is the study of atoms - how they bind together to make one substance, and then interact with other atoms to make a new substance. The word [i]chemistry[/i] is directly borrowed from the word [i][[alchemy]][/i].

Use this tag for posts explaining or depicting the topic of chemistry, chemical experiments, etc.. Not simply due to the presence of identifiable [[chemicals|chemical]] substance.
h4. Examples
* !post #7602258
* !post #5530998

title: flask
body:
A glass container commonly used in [[laboratory|laboratories]] to hold liquids. The most common shapes of flask are a conical body with a tubular neck (an [[Erlenmeyer flask]]) and a spherical body with a tubular neck (a [[round-bottom flask]]).

title: measuring_cylinder
body:
A measuring cylinder, also known as a graduated cylinder or mixing cylinder, is a piece of [[laboratory]] equipment used to measure the volume of a liquid. It has a narrow cylindrical shape with lines marking the amount of liquid that has been poured.

h4. See also

* [[flask]]

* [[test tube]]

* "Wikipedia: Graduated cylinder":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graduated_cylinder

title: science
body:
Any branch of study related to factual truths and principles. Likewise, it can be used to discover any facts that have not been uncovered yet using current systematic methods such as hypothesizing, observing, experimenting, measuring, and formulating laws to describe these facts.

There are numerous branches of science, and countless tools used to discover and/or prove these facts. Different scientific branches include [[math]]ematics, [[chemistry]], [[astronomy]], biology, engineering, medicine, social sciences, and physics, to name a few.

title: suletta_mercury
body:
The main protagonist of [[Gundam Suisei no Majo]] and the first female protagonist of a [[Gundam]] TV anime.

She is [spoilers] one of the 2 daughters of [[Elnora Samaya]] (a.k.a. [[Prospera Mercury]]) and a clone of [[Ericht Samaya]][/spoilers]. Suletta is also the pilot of [[Gundam Aerial]], its [[Gundam Aerial Rebuild]] upgrade, and the [[Gundam Calibarn]].

She is typically paired with [[Miorine Rembran]]. [spoilers]In the end of the series she marries [[Miorine Rembran]] as seen on both of their ring finger wearing matching wedding ring, thus making them the first confirmed [[yuri|lesbian]] couple of the franchise (and their fans [[himedanshi]])[/spoilers].

Her voice actress is [[Ichinose Kana]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6872533

title: ohdo_yuga
body: The main protagonist of [[Yu-Gi-Oh! SEVENS]] and one of the returning character in [[Yu-Gi-Oh! GO RUSH!!]].

title: kirishima_roa
body: Roa Kirishima (霧島 ロア Kirishima Roa), known in the Englihs dub as "Roa Kassidy", is one of the seven main characters in the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! SEVENS]] anime. He is the leader of RoaRomin, the band he and his cousin [[Kirishima Romin|Romin]] play in, as well as one of [[Ohdo Yuga|Yuga]]'s rivals.

title: kirishima_romin
body: Romin Kirishima (霧島 ロミン Kirishima Romin), known in the English dub as "Romin Kassidy", is one of the seven main characters in the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! SEVENS]] anime. She is [[Ohdo Yuga]]'s classmate, and a talented student and sportswoman who is the guitarist of RoaRomin, the Elementary School Band. Romin originally befriended Yuga and his friends with the intention of spying on them for her cousin, [[Kirishima Roa]].

title: kamijou_tatsuhisa
body: Tatsuhisa Kamijo (上城 龍久  Kamijō Tatsuhisa), nicknamed Luke (ルーク Rūku), known in the English dub as "Lucidian Kallister", is one of the seven main characters in the [[Yu-Gi-Oh! SEVENS]] anime. He is one of [[Ohdo Yuga]]'s best friends and rivals, and schoolmate from the next class over, and the self-proclaimed number one Duelist at Goha #7 Elementary. He is also the younger brother to [[Kamijou Haruka]].

title: eye-tee_(project_wingman)
body:
A character in [[Project Wingman]] serving as the [[driver_(project_wingman)|Driver's]] WSO when flying a two-seater aircraft. 

As Division's K-9's TAC names are based on their civilian professions, Eye-Tee is an IT technician.

title: driver_(project_wingman)
body:
The player character in [[Project Wingman]]'s campaign DLC; Project Wingman: Frontline 59. A reservist for the Federation Air Reserve, Driver serves as the flight lead for Division K-9. Like [[Monarch_(Project_wingman)|Monarch]] in the main campaign, if the player should fly a two-seater aircraft, he will be joined by a WSO, in Driver's case; [[eye-tee_(project_wingman)|Eye-Tee]].

As Division's K-9's TAC names are based on their civilian professions, Driver has an unspecified motorized job.

title: dancer_(fire_emblem:_three_houses)
body:
The [[dancer]] class as depicted in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]].

Notably, in contrast to the dancer's depiction in other [[Fire Emblem]] games, the dancer class in [i]Three Houses[/i] has a notable [[ancient greek clothes|Greek]]/[[roman clothes|Roman]]-styled attire as opposed to the [[arabian clothes|Arabian]] style seen in other entries of the series.

The male variation of the dancer outfit in Three Houses consists of a [[tunic]], while the female variation of the dancer outfit in Three Houses consists of a [[single-shoulder dress]]; both attires are usually white for most characters by default. The outfit also includes a [[choker]] around the neck, [[armlet]]s and [[bracelet]]s on the arms, a [[belly chain]] around the waist, and a pair of [[sandals]].

title: roberto_(gundam)
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He appears in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]Roberto[/b] is a veteran [[AEUG]] mobile suit pilot and one of [[Quattro Bajeena]]'s wingmen. His [[mobile_Suit|MS]] of choice is the [[Rick Dias]], initially painted black and grey, then red.

[spoilers]Roberto used to be a [[Zeon]] MS pilot (Real name: Ricardo Vega) during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. He dies while participating in a ground battle while protecting an AEUG [[space shuttle]], killed when his Rick Dias was destroyed by a [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] [[Asshimar]] during the [i]Battle of Kennedy Spaceport[/i].[/spoilers]

title: hirake!_ponkikki
body:
A Japanese program for children staring a green [[buck teeth|bucktooth]] [[dinosaur]] named [[Gachapin]] and a large red Yeti named [[Mukku]]. 

[b]Note:[/b] Only use this tag for Gachapin or when there is reference to it. Try to leave his Vocaloid variant ([[Ryuuto (vocaloid)|]]) separate.

title: jean_bart_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the French battleship [i]Jean Bart[/i]. Character design by [[Akira (Kadokawa)|]].

She is portrayed with Akira's distinctive [[pale skin]] color, [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[blue hair|blue]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], [[blue eyes]], two [[mole under eye|moles under her left eye]], and [[medium breasts]]. 

Her outfit consists of a [[white shirt|white]] patterned [[strapless shirt]] with [[bare shoulders]], a long [[scarf]] that is designed off her real-life camouflage pattern, [[beret]], and black [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her two 380 mm quad main gun mounts, one on each side.

Hastily evacuated half-complete as the Germans took over France, she was at anchor in Casablanca (assigned to Vichy France after 1940 armistice), when the Allies took the base in November 1942 (the setting of the Summer 2022 event), leading to her gunnery exchange with [i][[Massachusetts (kancolle)|]][/i] where she was severely damaged. She was then handled over to the Allies after, she was not completed until 1949 and decommissioned a decade later.

h4. Skins

* !post #5661300: Default
* !post #5878273: Winter
* !post #7657962: 11th Anniversary

body:
A playable [[Honkai: Star Rail]] character. A member of the [[Chrysos Heirs (honkai: star rail)|]], voiced by [[Endou Aya]] (JP) and [[Morgan Garrett]] (EN). 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her outfit is [[Greco-Roman clothes|Greco-Roman]] in theme and consists of a golden [[laurel crown]], ornate [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[white dress]], laurel-themed black [[thigh strap]] on her right leg, single [[shoulder armor]] on her left, and [[gold footwear|gold]] [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[gladiator sandals]].

title: welt_yang
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]] who originated from the [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] timeline. Voiced by [[Hosoya Yoshimasa]] in Japanese. 

He has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[yellow eyes]], and wears [[glasses]]. His default outfit in Star Rail consists of a [[black shirt|black undershirt]], [[double-breasted]] [[white shirt]], [[grey jacket]], [[black pants]], [[grey scarf]], and [[black footwear|black]] leather shoes. His main weapon is a copy of the 9th Divine Key Star of Eden that he replicates using his Reason powers, taking the form of a cane. 
 
A seasoned member of the [[Astral Express (honkai: star rail)|]] crew and the former sovereign of Anti-Entropy who has saved Earth from annihilation, having inherited the name of the world "Welt". He is the second Herrscher of Reason from his world, having found himself and [[Void Archives]] in the Star Rail world-cluster after the events of the Alien Space manga. 


h4. Appearance

* !post #7689883: Splash art (featuring Void Archives, Tesla, Einstein, and Joyce)
* !post #8768316: In the Name of the World (signature Light Cone)

body:
Character from [[Fire Emblem Engage]]. The second princess of Elusia and [[ivy (fire emblem)|Ivy]]'s half-sister.

h5. Appearance
[b]Hair & Face[/b]
[[two-tone_hair|two-tone]] [[pink hair]] with [[white_hair|white]] [[streaked_hair|streaks]]. Hair style consists two [[hair rings]] with [[sidelocks]], [[hair flaps]] and [[blunt bangs]], [[short hair]] in length. She has [[pink eyes]] with a [[heart facial mark]] / [[heart tattoo]] under her right eye.

h5. Attire

* !post #7235950: Main
* !asset #21389245: Casual
* !post #8557416: [[hortensia_(winter's_dearest)_(fire_emblem)|Winter's Dearest]]

[b]Main costume[/b]
Her main attire includes a [[frilled dress|frilled]], [[layered dress|layered]], [[cross-laced_dress|cross-laced]], [[two-tone_dress|two-tone]] [[blue_dress|blue]]/[[aqua dress]] with [[vertical-striped_dress|vertical stripes]], [[criss-cross_halter]] and [[juliet_sleeves|juliet]], [[fur-trimmed_sleeves|fur-trimmed]] [[long sleeves]], [[pink sash]] and a [[cleavage cutout]]. The dress has three [[red_rose|red roses]] attached to it. Her legs are covered in [[vertical-striped_pantyhose|vertical-striped]] [[two-tone_pantyhose|two-tone]] [[blue_pantyhose|blue]]/[[aqua pantyhose]]. She has [[pointy_footwear|pointy]] [[blue_footwear|blue]] [[high heels]] as her footwear and a [[multicolored tiara]] decorated with [[pink gemstone]] on top of her head.

[b][[official_alternate costume|Official alternate]] casual costume[/b]
Her second costume includes a [[layered_skirt|layered]], [[plaid_skirt|plaid]] [[blue skirt]], [[black dress]] with a [[red rose]] attached, [[pink_jacket|pink]] [[cropped jacket]] with [[epaulettes]] and [[fur-trimmed sleeves]], [[black pantyhose]] with a [[floral print]], [[pointy_footwear|pointy]] [[red_footwear|red]] [[high heels]], [[black choker]], [[black gloves]], [[heart earrings]] and a [[polka_dot_bow|polka-dotted]] [[black_bow|black]] [[hair bow]]. This costume leaves her [[collarbone]] visible.

body:
A symbol of the 1970s, along with the peace sign. It is a stylized [[smile|smiling]] face drawn as a yellow circle with two black dots and a black arc representing eyes and a mouth.

title: gundam_seed
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam Seed[/b] is a [[mecha]] anime TV series that spans fifty episodes, which broadcasted in Japan from October 5, 2002 to September 27, 2003 on the JNN TV stations TBS and MBS. It has mecha designs by [[Ookawara Kunio]] and character designs by [[Hirai Hisashi]].

Gundam Seed takes place in an alternate universe (Cosmic Era) and is constantly compared to the first series, [[Mobile Suit Gundam]], which occur in the year 0079 (Universal Century).

It is very infamous for [[derivative work|copying battle scenes]] from older [[Gundam]] series.

h4. See also

* [[Gundam Seed Astray]] - side stories to Gundam Seed
* [[Gundam Seed Destiny]] - the sequel to Gundam Seed
** [[Gundam Seed C.E. 73: Stargazer]] - a side story to Gundam Seed Destiny
* [[Gundam Seed Freedom]] - the sequel to Gundam Seed Destiny

h4. External links

title: cameltoe
body:
The contour in the fabric of a lower garment (e.g. [[panties]], [[bikini]], [[shorts]]) in the shape of a woman's [[labia]], vaguely reminiscent of a [[camel]]'s toes. It is the result of very tight-fitting clothes.

When the pussy forms a cameltoe-like shape but does not have clothing covering it, tag it as [[cleft of venus]] instead. The only time both can apply is when the clothing is see-through.

title: jiu_niangzi
body:
[b]Jiu Niangzi[/b] is a playable character from [[Reverse:1999]]. She is one of the protagonist of the "Notes on Shuori" sidestory. A kind-hearted tavern owner who loves lending hand on people, despite always ended up in failures. She's actually a Lushu, a mythical beast with the appearance of a horse with a tiger's skin and a red tail. She unknowingly transformed [[Yenisei (Reverse:1999)|Yenisei]]'s expedition team into half-Lushus through her wooden doll, starting the main conflict of the sidestory.

She is voiced by Melody Peng in English, Xie Ying in Chinese and [[Tomita Miyu]] in Japanese.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7048077: Insight II: Let There Be Way Out

body:

A mad scientist from the Laplace Scientific Computing Center, Medicine Pocket was born without reproductive organs and consider themselves non-binary (while Medicine Pocket prefers them/they pronouns, they will allow other people to use he/she pronouns on them much to their annoyance).

title: liszt_juli
body:
Character from [[Aikatsu Stars!]]. She's a student at [[venus ark uniform|Venus Ark]]. She has a close resemblance to [[ashida yuuri|Ashida Yuuri]], except color-coded differently: they share the same voice actress as well in [[Koga Aoi]]. She's from [[Hungary]]: her name is most likely derived from the Hungarian composer [[Franz Liszt]]. 

Due to her being Hungarian, her naming order is similar to the Japanese one: her surname is Liszt and her given name is Juli (pronounced as yoo-lee).

title: aikatsu!
body:
An arcade collectible card game developed by Bandai company, launched in October 2012. It is adapted into an anime by Sunrise, began airing from October 8, 2012. A Nintendo 3DS game was released on November 15, 2012.

The series takes place at Starlight Academy (スターライト学園), a prestigious school with both middle school and high school divisions, where girls train to become idols and take part in various auditions. To participate in these auditions, players use Aikatsu cards, special cards which contain digitalised dresses and accessories from various manufacturers. How well they succeed is often dependent on choosing the right combination of cards. The video games cast players in the role of a new student, who must train to become an idol and reach the top.

The anime series follows [[Hoshimiya Ichigo]], who idolizes the top star [[Kanzaki Mizuki]] and decides to enroll in Starlight Academy together with her best friend [[Kiriya Aoi]]. Not long after, Ichigo and Aoi become close with [[Shibuki Ran]], one of their classmates. Together, the trio train for auditions and aim to become top idols.

body:

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[green eyes]]. His outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white jacket]] worn over a [[black shirt]], [[white pants]], [[black gloves]], green [[armband]] to his left sleeve, and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: otto_apocalypse
body:
A [i][[Honkai Impact 3rd]][/i] character. Voiced by [[Ishida Akira (voice Actor)|]] (regular) and [[Ogata Megumi]] (young). 

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied to a [[low ponytail]], and [[green eyes]]. His default outfit consists of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[black shirt]] worn under a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white jacket]], [[white pants]], [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]], [[red sash]], and a [[cross]] dangling from his jacket.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6133088: Reference sheet

h4. Background
[expand]
The son of Nikolas Apocalypse and Sabrina Schariac, Otto was born in 1452 as a member of House Apocalypse. During his childhood, he met [[Kallen Kaslana]] and deemed her as his only friend, vowing together to save the world against the threat of the Honkai. When Kallen's father died for fighting the Honkai, Otto later discovered the 1st Divine Key, Void Archives into hopes of bringing back her late father, which he ended up reconsidering as her father's sacrifice will be in vain. This Divine Key would later assist him in his later goals.

Afterwards in his adulthood, Otto became the next Overseer of Schicksal (specifically the 227th), securing the position for the next 500 years in his own callous obsession of finding ways to revive Kallen. In one of his cloning attempts, he created [[Theresa Apocalypse]] and would later adopt her as his granddaughter.
[/expand]

h4. See also
* [[Void Archives]] - related HI3 character.
* [[Luocha (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] - his [[Honkai: Star Rail]] counterpart.
other_names: オットー・アポカリプス

title: void_archives
body:
[[Honkai Impact 3rd]] non-playable character.

The Divine Key made from the core of the Previous Era's Herrscher of Reason and thus capable of creating replicas of weapons. Originally a gold cube, it fell into the hands of [[Otto Apocalypse]], and took control of one of his Soulium bodies after his death. In the latter form, it was responsible for bringing the Sky People to Earth and causing the St. Fountain Incident depicted in A Post-Honkai Odyssey.

Its subsequent status is unknown, but given its appearance in [[Welt Yang]]'s [[Honkai: Star Rail]] official art (post #5615313) and Welt having flashbacks of it upon seeing [[Luocha (Honkai: Star Rail)|]], its future return is likely. 

h4. See also
* [[Otto Apocalypse]] - related HI3 character.
* [[Luocha (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] - his [[Honkai: Star Rail]] counterpart.

title: too_many_eyes
body:
There are [[too many|a lot of]] eyes in a picture. An exaggeration of [[extra eyes]], often to the point of invoking [[trypophobia]].
A favorite trait of [[eldritch abomination]]s, [[biblically accurate angel]]s, or similar supernatural entities.

title: biblically_accurate_angel
body:
A term from internet vernacular referring to the scary and bizarre [[eldritch abomination|representations]] of the [[angel]]s.

The term "biblically accurate" may be misleading, as angels appear infrequently throughout several texts in Judaism and Christianity, and many do appear like the popular depiction of angels. This tag refers to the living creatures described in the Book of Ezekiel and various esoterica, which are terrifying to behold, and tend to have [[extra eyes]] and [[multiple wings]], among other strange features.

Notable types of angels include:
* [[cherub|cherubim]], angels with four heads - human, ox, lion, and bird
* [[ophan|ophanim]], wheels covered in eyes

h4. See also

* [[Angel (Evangelion)]]
* [[Galeem]]
* [[WhiteNight (project moon)|]]
* [[Zero Two (Kirby)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Angels in Judaism":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angels_in_Judaism]
* "Wikipedia: Living creatures (Bible)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Living_creatures_(Bible)]
* "Wikipedia: Ezekiel 1":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ezekiel_1]

title: dragon
body:
A mythical creature, typically presented as a large, flying reptilian creature.

[[Western dragon]]s are typically lizard-like creatures with wings and the ability to breathe fire. [[Eastern dragon]]s are typically more snake-like, with the ability to fly through the air without wings.

This tag is for the mythical creature. For people that have dragon-like features, see [[dragon girl]] or [[dragon boy]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7806601: [[Western dragon]]
* !post #7070533: [[Eastern dragon]]

title: western_dragon
body:
A [[dragon]] with [[wings]], a long neck, tail, and four legs. Usually walks on all fours but is sometimes seen standing or even walking on only two. A staple of any fantasy series.

Differs from [[eastern dragon]]s with its thicker body, wings, and closer resemblance to a lizard (or by modern knowledge, a dinosaur) than a snake.

h4. Examples

* !post #7806601
* !post #7702401

title: eastern_dragon
body:
A [[dragon]] with the serpent-like features seen in East Asian mythology.

Eastern dragon typically have long lean bodies, four comparatively short legs, two long "whiskers", two horns reminiscent of [[antlers]], a tail with a tuft of hair at its tip, and no wings, flying through floating through the air rather than flapping.

h4. Examples

* !post #7890127
* !post #7723844
* !post #7070533

h4. See also

* [[Western dragon]]
* [[Seiryuu]], azure dragon of the east, one of the "Four Symbols":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Four_Symbols_%28China%29 of the Chinese constellations.

title: yahagi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Yahagi[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Yamada Yuuki (voice actor)|]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]] with a red [[scrunchie]] and has notable [[sidelocks]] and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit is her class' uniform: a [[sleeveless]] [[serafuku]] that exposes her [[midriff]], [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], dark [[blue necktie]], [[white gloves]], [[black belt]], [[rudder footwear]], and [[asymmetrical legwear]] where the left leg has a [[single thighhigh]] stocking on a [[garter_straps|garter strap]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, two hull pieces containing her three real-life 15.2 twin gun mounts with a [[joystick]] control, an 8 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount on her right [[rudder footwear|rudder boot]], and her [[flight deck]] on the left boot. 

She speaks in a serious tone, with militaristic terminology. She has a line about enjoying [[Sasebo]] burgers (named after her hometown) as an uncharacteristic soft side to her. While she acts mature around her sisters, she tends to play an awed junior to (or romantic interest to) [[Yamato (Kancolle)|]].

The historical [i]Yahagi[/i] was sunk a couple months before the end of the war in the ill-fated [[Operation Ten-gou]], a suicide mission which sank [[Yamato (Kancolle)|]] and virtually everyone else involved. Because of this, she almost always appears either with Yamato, her sister ships, or guarding destroyers.

h4. Appearance

title: seppuku
body:
Also known as hara-kiri, a form of ritual [[suicide]] by [[disembowelment]]. Primarily practiced by the [[samurai]], seppuku was used to die with honor rather than falling into the hands of an enemy, as a means of punishment for serious offenses, as a means of protest against a lord's decision, or to atone for dishonor, such as a shameful deed or a failure to protect one's lord.

It was performed by the samurai using a tanto or wakizashi to cut open one's belly from left to right in a slicing motion, at which point the [[kaishakunin]], the samurai's second, had the job of finishing the job by beheading him before he could show any sign of pain or loss of composure.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Seppuku":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seppuku]

title: shirayuki_(kancolle)
body: The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Shirayuki[/i] in [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] in [[short_twintails|short]] [[low twintails]] with [[parted bangs]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit, the Special-Type uniform, is a [[serafuku]] comprising a [[white shirt]], [[blue sailor collar]], [[neckerchief]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her funnel and foremast carried as a form of backpack, while carrying two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap|thigh straps]] and a 12.7 twin gun mount Type A as a [[handgun]]. In real life, [i]Shirayuki[/i] was part of DesDiv11 and saw action in the battles of Sunda Strait, [[battle of Midway|Midway]], and Naval Guadalcanal. She was sunk in the battle of the Bismarck Sea on March 3rd, 1943 near Papua New Guinea. [[Shikinami (Kancolle)|]] rescued her survivors. h4. title: uranami_(kancolle)
body: The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Uranami[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied to a side [[single braid]], and [[brown eyes]]. Although she is listed as a Special Type I (Fubuki-class) destroyer, she is actually of an intermediary design between the Types I and II, with the funnels of the later type but with the guns of the earlier type. As such, she wears a variant of the "basic" uniform: a blue-and-white short-sleeved [[serafuku]] but with a brown collar (blue sailor collar) and a brown [[neckerchief]] characteristic of Shibafu's Ayanami-class. She completes the set with a blue [[pleated skirt]], [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and a [[red ribbon]] on her braid. Her [[rigging]] consists of a funnel-mast backpack set, two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s, and a 12.7 cm twin mount as a [[handgun]]. Her official art also has her swinging an [[anchor]] in her left hand. She has a similar "forthright energetic" personality to [[Fubuki (Kancolle)|]], although with a somewhat more [[tomboy]]ish edge. She also has a strong respect for/dependency upon her sister-ship, [[Isonami (kancolle)|]], referring to her or asking for help from her whenever she is in trouble. She similarly has a strong attachment to her other historic division-mates, [[Ayanami (kancolle)|]] and [[Shikinami (kancolle)|]]. The real-life [i]Uranami[/i] was part of DesDiv 19 with sister-ships [i]Isonami[/i], [i]Ayanami[/i], and [i]Shikinami[/i]. During the [[Battle of Midway]], they were on escort duty, and [i]Uranami[/i] and [i]Isonami[/i] collided. She spent most of the war as an escort or a transport destroyer, and was eventually sunk in the [[Battle of Leyte Gulf]] in October 1944 alongside [[Kinu (Kancolle)|]]. h4. title: bad_end
body:
Images depicting a [b]bad end[/b](ing) for the protagonist, such as an [[alternate universe]] where the villain managed to defeat the hero instead of vice-versa.

Please note that 'bad' does not mean 'poor quality' here, so do not use this tag for images you feel show bad writing on the artist's part. Also do not use this tag for fake "[[game over]]" scenes, unless the scene is particularly tragic (dead character, monster closing in, etc.).

h4. See also:

* [[defeat]]
* [[death]]
* [[good end]]
* [[instant loss]]

title: za_warudo
body:
A [[meme]] which was noticeably featured in "this flash animation":/post/show/107964 where [[Dio Brando]] and [[The World]] beat down a stickman, stopped time, threw knives, and [[road roller da! (meme)|crushed it with a steamroller]] with a cry of "[[WRYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY]]". 

The whole thing is based on the conclusion of the third story arc of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. It's also often associated with [[Izayoi Sakuya]] from [[Touhou]] due to her similar abilities. 

Unless there is a specific reference to the "ZA WARUDO" meme, it is simply [[time stop]].

title: the_magician_(tarot)
body:
The first of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

Traditionally a practitioner of ordinary stage magic, the Magician became a [[wizard]] in occult decks designed for divination. The Magician usually has one hand pointing skyward and the other hand pointed to the ground. Many depictions of the Magician include items symbolizing the four suits of the Minor Arcana: a [[wand]], a [[cup]], a [[sword]] or [[knife]], and a [[pentacle]] or [[coin]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24747541: [[Rider-Waite tarot|Rider-Waite]]

h4.See also

* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: the_fool_(tarot)
body:
One of the cards in a [[tarot]] deck. The Fool may be numbered 0 or ∞ (infinity).

h4. Appearance

Depending on the deck, the Fool may be depicted as a beggar in ragged clothes or a young man walking towards the edge of a [[cliff|precipice]]. The Fool is often seen wearing a [[jester cap]] and/or carrying a [[bindle]], and they may be accompanied by a dog.

* !asset #24747535: [[Rider-Waite tarot|Rider-Waite]]

h4.See also

* [[joker (playing card)|]]
* [[tarot]]
* [[Tag Group:Cards]]

title: final_fantasy_sonic_x
body:
Final Fantasy Sonic X is a 7-part RPG-style flash game series made by the late "BlackDevilX":[https://blackdevilx.newgrounds.com/], released between 2004 and 2018. Popularized on [[Newgrounds]] and other sites hosting flash games, it features characters from [[Sonic (Series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] and [[Mega Man X (series)|]]. Art made in tribute to the series most commonly features [[Super Sonic]] holding a red [[buster sword]].

h4. Original characters

* [[Aeon the Hedgehog]]

title: mixed-sex_combat
body:
A [[fighting|fight]] between men and women. Mixed-sex combat arts usually involves [[ryona]]/[[reverse ryona]] and [[femdom]] elements as a part of a fetish, and [[humiliation]] is a recurring occurence.

For a fight which involves sexual elements, uses the tag [[sex battle]].

title: miside
body:
A Russian psychological horror/comedy video game presented as a dating sim, developed by AIHASTO.

The game revolves around various [[Mita (miside)|]]s, primarily [[Crazy Mita (miside)|]], who are characters from a mobile game that the [[Player Character (MiSide)|]] downloaded on his smartphone. As the story progress, the player encounters various Mitas, helping them and receiving their help, in order to defeat [[Crazy Mita (miside)|]].

body:
A fomer [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] affiliated with [[Nijisanji]], and was a member of [[Nijisanji Gamers]].

A soft spoken [[demon girl]] with a very laid back personality. She normally has a Gothic or punkish appearance, wearing a [[torn shirt]] over a [[black dress]] with [[two-tone hair]] (black and pink) and [[bags under eyes|bags under her eyes]]. 

For reasons unknown, Moruru suddenly announced her retirement["link":[https://twitter.com/_rnrrdark/status/1143068617098981381]] on June 24, 2019. Her last stream would be a few days later on June 27, and a short while after all videos on her channel were made private or otherwise removed.

title: nose_hook
body:
A special type of hook that is hooked under the nostrils then used to pull the nose upwards.

From the Yuribou Hentai Dictionary:

顔面攻撃 (ganmen kōgeki), lit. "face attack". A variation on S/M play in which the captive girl's face is contorted to make it look ugly so she is embarrassed and feels dominated, and the men feel domineering and virile. Commonly used are fingers in nostrils or mouth, or retractor devices, attached to a headpiece or collar, which hold open the mouth or nostrils. The nose-specific version is called "hana-zeme" (鼻責め "nose play"), and the retractor devices for it are "hana hukku" (鼻フッウ "nose hook").

title: type_11_light_machine_gun
body:
The first [[light machine gun]] to be mass-produced for the [[Imperial Japanese Army]]. The weapon is easily distinguished by its open-topped ammunition hopper, which was also the weapon's greatest defect: allowing dirt and mud to easily infiltrate the gun, leading to jams. This gave the gun a poor reputation amongst Japanese soldiers, and calls to fix it led to the Type 11's successor, the [[Type 96 light machine gun]].

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_11_light_machine_gun]

title: gold_experience_requiem
body:
Evolved requiem form of the [[stand (jojo)|]] [[Gold Experience]] from the end of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 5, [[Vento Aureo]].

[spoiler]In addition to increased life creation power, GER has gained "nullification" ability, which can be used to "nullify" any attempt made by an enemy to harm it and [[Giorno Giovanna|its user]] through manipulation of space, time, and fate itself, and reversing anything around them to the original state. 

When anyone is "killed" by GER, they will stuck in an infinite loop of them suffering all kinds of fatal injuries over and over, only for them to be moved to the new scenario when they are about to "die" in the previous world and suffering the same fate again, rinse and repeat.[/spoiler]

title: sonic_the_hedgehog_(film)
body:
A 2020 action-adventure comedy film based on the [[Sonic (series)|]] video game franchise, directed by Jeff Fowler and written by Pat Casey and Josh Miller and produced by [[Paramount Pictures]].

The film had a great controversy over Sonic's initial [[ugly sonic|humanoid looking design]], which has also been described as adjacent to the uncanny valley. Due to the bad reception to this design, the movie was postponed and Sonic got a redesign much closer to his game counterpart, which received much more praise.

The film stars Ben Schwartz as the voice for [[Sonic the Hedgehog]] and [[Jim Carrey]] as [[Dr. Eggman|Dr. Robotnik]], as well as James Marsden, Tika Sumpter, Natasha Rothwell, Adam Pally, and Neal McDonough. In the film, Sonic teams up with local town sheriff [[Tom Wachowski]] to find his lost rings while they escape from Robotnik.

h4. See also
* [[Ugly Sonic]] - The aforementioned earlier, unpopular design.
* [[Sonic the Hedgehog 2 (film)]]


h4. External links
* "Sonic News Network: Sonic the Hedgehog (film)":[https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Sonic_the_Hedgehog_(film)]
* "Wikipedia: Sonic the Hedgehog (film)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sonic_the_Hedgehog_(film)]

title: sonic_the_hedgehog
body:
One of the most iconic and instantly recognizable figures of pop culture in entertainment. Starring in several cartoons and anime, movies, a hit video game series, and holds the record for the longest running comic book series based from a [[video game]] franchise. 

The main hero of the [[Sonic (series)|]] franchise, [b]Sonic the Hedgehog[/b] is a blue-colored hedgehog who can run at extremely fast speeds, and has a upbeat personality with a smarty-pants attitude while always looking forward to adventures. He loves chili dogs and rock music. He makes friends easily, but will equally not forgive anyone who threatens his friends and the world. His long-time nemesis is [[Dr. Eggman]], but they seem to uphold their rivalry on decent terms. Sonic can also change his form state, by collecting all 7 of the [[Chaos Emerald]]s and harnessing their positive energy to transform into Super Sonic; which bears a striking resemblance to a [[Super Saiyan]] from the [[Dragon Ball Z]] universe. This in turn grants him exponential speed and power increases, among flight abilities also making him immune to most attacks. 

Sonic was designed and created by Japanese artist and game designer "Oshima Naoto":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naoto_%C5%8Cshima. He was initially codenamed "Mr. Needlemouse" during development as Sega's new mascot and was originally colored teal. His trademark blue pigmentation was chosen later to match Sega's cobalt blue logo. "Uekawa Yuji":http://sonic.wikia.com/wiki/Yuji_Uekawa provided the revamping of Sonic The Hedgehog's art style with the shift to the 3D era with the [[Sonic Adventure]] games around 1998.

Sonic replaced [[Alex Kidd (character)|Alex Kidd]] as the official mascot of [[SEGA]] Corporation since 1991.

Voiced by Kanemaru Jun'ichi in Japan, and Jaleel White, Martin Burke, Ryan Drummond, Jason Griffith, and Roger Craig Smith in North America.

title: shoushimin_series
body:
〈小市民〉シリーズ, lit. [i]Petit Bourgeoisie[/i] is a mystery novel series by Yonezawa Honobu that was first published in December 2004 by Sougen Suiri Bunko. There is a Summer 2024 anime adaptation by [i]Lapin Track[/i]. 

Kobato Jougorou is  a  boy who wanted to reduce his habit of deducting and over-analyzing everything, Asanai Yuki is a girl who is avoided by others because of her strange tendencies. Both of them desire nothing more than to have a simple and peaceful high school life. This is a story about two people who are aiming and working together to be inconspicuous citizens (petit bourgeois).

h4. Characters

* [[Kobato Jougorou]]

title: super_sonic_2
body:
A super form that [[Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic]] takes in [[Sonic Frontiers]]. The form looks just like [[Super Sonic]] but instead of having [[red eyes]] they have been changed to [[blue eyes|blue]]; he also gains a red [[aura]] with [[electricity]], as opposed to the golden aura that Super Sonic is usually known for.

The form's name is conjectural, derived from [[Super Saiyan 2]].

title: emiya_alter
body:
Archer-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The same character as [[Archer (fate)|]], but has discarded his memories after a tragic incident and become an emotionless killer. Emiya Alter has darker skin than his original version, and has his hair very short with a [[crew cut]].

Due to Danbooru's policy of avoiding spoilers as much as possible, as well as simplifying how their costume character tags are categorized, Archer and Emiya Alter are to be treated as wholly separate characters.

For the corrupted version of Archer seen in [[Fate/Grand Order: First Order]], see [[Archer Alter (fate)|]].

title: love_live!_nijigasaki_high_school_idol_club_the_movie_-_finale
body:
A trilogy of theatrical movie follow-ups to the [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]] anime, featuring the girls participating in the School Idol Grand Prix, a tournament for solo school idols. Each movie has made a departure from the art style set in the anime prior.

The first part follows [[Uehara Ayumu]], [[Nakasu Kasumi]], [[Osaka Shizuku]], [[Konoe Kanata]], [[Emma Verde]], and [[Zhong Lanzhu]] in [[Okinawa]]. Its animation and art direction is handled by [[Kerorira]].

The second part features [[Miyashita Ai]], [[Yuki Setsuna]], [[Asaka Karin]], [[Tennoji Rina]], [[Mifune Shioriko]], and [[Mia Taylor]] in [[Osaka (city)|]].

title: serafuku
body:
The [[school uniform]] with a [[sailor collar|sailor-style collar]] worn by Japanese schoolgirls in middle school and high school. The standard uniform consists of a white [[blouse]], a [[pleated skirt]], and a red [[neckerchief]], but there are as many variations as there are stars in the sky. 
 
Serafukus are commonly worn with a [[ribbon]] or [[bow]] in lieu of the traditional neckerchief. The line between "neckerchief" and "bow" is blurry, as the bows worn with serafukus often aren't actually dedicated bows or [[bowtie|bowties]], but rather a neckerchief tied into a bow instead of its intended scarf-like shape.
 
A serafuku always includes a [[skirt]]. If a sailor-style top is paired with shorts or another bottom, [[sailor shirt]] should be used instead. In fact, sailor suits with shorts are the older, original style: in the Victorian and Edwardian eras, they were used as boys' suits, from which then the girls' uniform with a skirt was derived.

For colored serafuku tags, both the [[shirt]] and [[skirt]] must match in color to apply, but not the neckwear or [[sailor collar]].

[[Sailor dress]]es should not be tagged as serafuku.
 
h4. Examples

* !post #7976696: [[Summer uniform]]
* !post #7610906: [[Winter uniform]]
* !post #8805259: [[white serafuku]][br]Shirt and skirt must be white.

title: snowbell_(flower)
body:
[b][i]Leucojum[/i][/b], commonly known as snowbell or snowflake, is a genus of [[flower]]ing plants in the family [i]Amaryllidaceae[/i]. There are only two species, the summer [i]Leucojum aestivum[/i] and the spring [i]Leucojum vernum[/i].

Snowbells produce [[white flower|white]], nodding, bell-shaped flowers. The flowers are six-petaled with a green or yellow spot at the tip of each petal. [i]Leucojum vernum[/i] usually produces one (rarely two) flowers per stem, while [i]Leucojum aestivum[/i] produces three, five or seven. Each flower grows on a separate stem called a pedicel, which is attached to the main stem. Each pedicel ends in a distinctive bulb-like outer (inferior) ovary to which the flower is attached.

Not to be confused with [[snowdrop (flower)|]], which has the same color and spots, and [[lily of the valley]], which has the same color and shape. The flowers of the former have three long outer petals and three much shorter inner petals, while the flowers of the latter have no spots and no bulb-like outer ovaries to which the flowers are attached.

* !asset #21737370: Flowers: [i]Leucojum aestivum[/i]

title: sega
body:
[b]Sega Corporation[/b] (株式会社セガ [i]Kabushiki gaisha Sega[/i]), pronounced /ˈseɪɡə/ (US/Canada/UK/New Zealand/Australia) and usually styled as [b]SEGA[/b], is a Japanese multinational [[video game]] developer, publisher and hardware development company headquartered in Tokyo, Japan, with various offices around the world. 

The company started as the merger of two different coin-operated game machine companies made by Americans: [i]Service Games[/i] created in Hawaii in 1940 and [i]Rosen Enterprises[/i] founded in Japan in 1954. The name SEGA comes from [b]SE[/b]rvice [b]GA[/b]mes.

Originally a maker of video [[game console]]s, it later shifted into just creating and publishing video games for other game consoles. However, in 2019 the company published a miniature version of their popular Sega Mega Drive console with several built-in games included.

SEGA is the creator of the popular [[Sonic (series)|]] franchise.

Since 2013, it is the parent company of fellow publisher [[Atlus]].

SEGA was also a major [[arcade]] operator and owned several iconic arcades in Japan.  Due to declining income, especially caused by the COVID-19 Pandemic, in 2022 they completely sold off their arcade operations division to GENDA Inc.  All remaining SEGA branded arcades to be rebranded with the "GiGO" logo (short for "Get into the Gaming Oasis").

title: otome_game_no_hametsu_flag_shika_nai_akuyaku_reijou_ni_tensei_shite_shimatta
body:
English title: "My Next Life as a Villainess: All Routes Lead to Doom!"

An isekai story about a tomboyish otaku gamer who is reincarnated in to the villainous rival of the heroine in the game she played.  Being focused upon avoiding the Bad End flags of her story to the point of being oblivious to all else, the girl doesn't realize she's ruined the story by having a personality that out-heroines the original heroine and successfully builds a "reverse harem" for herself by mistake.

Illustrated by [[Hidaka Nami]].

h4. Characters

* [[Katarina Claes]] - Main character - [[aqua eyes]] in strong [[tsurime]] shape, [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[swept bangs]], a [[hair ribbon]] and [[hairclip|barrette]].
* [[Anne Shelley]] - Main character's [[maid]] - [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]], [[swept bangs]].
* [[Geordo Stuart]] - 3rd prince/main character's fiancee - [[blonde hair]], [[swept bangs]], [[hair between eyes]], and [[blue eyes]].
* [[Keith Claes]] - Main character's younger brother - [[brown hair|brown]] [[wavy hair]] with [[parted bangs]] and [[sidelocks]], [[sanpaku]] [[aqua eyes]].
* [[Mary Hunt]] - Katarina's friend - [[yuri]] romantic interest - [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair|brown]]/[[red hair]], [[swept bangs]], and [[brown eyes|brown]]/[[red eyes]].
* [[Alan Stuart]] - 4th prince and Mary's (supposed) fiancee - [[grey hair]], [[asymmetrical bangs]], and [[blue eyes]].
* [[Sophia Ascart]] - Katarina's friend - [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]], [[hair ribbon]], [[blunt bangs]], [[red eyes]] in [[tareme]] style.
* [[Nicol Ascart]] - Sophia's brother - [[black eyes]], [[black hair]], [[asymmetrical bangs]] with [[hair between eyes]].
* [[Maria Campbell]] - Original heroine - [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[hair flower|hair flowers]], [[green eyes|green]] [[tareme]] eyes.
* [[Raphael Wolt]] - [spoiler]"Sirius Dieke", student council president[/spoiler] - [[red hair|red]] [[curly hair]], [[grey eyes]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: My Next Life as a Villainess: All Routes Lead to Doom!":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/My_Next_Life_as_a_Villainess:_All_Routes_Lead_to_Doom!]

title: daffodil
body:
[b][i]Narcissus[/i][/b], commonly called daffodil, is a genus of [[flower]]ing plants in the family [i]Amaryllidaceae[/i]. The scientific name of the plant is often linked to the myth of [[Narcissus]], who became so obsessed with his [[narcissism|own reflection]] in water that he drowned, although it is not clear whether the flower was named after the myth or the myth after the flower. The other common name is jonquil, after a particular species of the family.

Daffodil flowers grow at about a right angle to the stem and have a cup- or trumpet-shaped protruding center surrounded by 6 petal-like tepals (undifferentiated petals and sepals). The flowers may come in a limited variety of colors, most often white and yellow, sometimes orange. Depending on the species, the tepals may be a different color than the center.

In the east, they are considered a symbol of wealth and good fortune, and since they bloom in early spring are often associated with the Chinese New Year. The bulbs are mildly poisonous and must be handled with care but were once a part of traditional Japanese medicine.

title: 37_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]37[/b] is a playable character in [[Reverse:1999]]. She is a member of Apeiron, an all-arcanist society that practices Pythagoreanism and believes all is explained by numbers, including themselves. Obsessed with that belief, 37 is indifferent to the material world, and only cares about numbers and shape of forms. She was gifted that she can accurately predict someone's exact number. She is a friend of [[Sophia (Reverse:1999)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]], and wears [[ancient greek clothes]].

She is voiced by Emily Stranges in English and [[Iguchi Yuka]] in Japanese.

h4. Appearance

title: commentary
body:
A post where the artist commentary is understandable by the average English speaker. This can be because it was translated by a Danbooru user into English from another language, the original commentary was already in [[English commentary|English]], or the commentary consists of [[symbol-only commentary|symbols]] or something similar.

Do not use this tag with [[mixed-language commentary]] unless [i]all[/i] non-English languages present have been translated.

For [i]untranslated[/i] artist commentary, use [[commentary request]] instead, plus the corresponding "[language]_commentary":/wiki_pages?search%5Btitle_normalize%5D=*_commentary&redirect=true tag if not Japanese.

If the only untranslated portions of a commentary are meta, such as hashtags or mentions, then tag it with [[commentary]] and not [[partial commentary]] or [[commentary request]].

h4. Related tags

h6. Languages

"Japanese commentary" is not a tag on Danbooru because it is treated as the default language. Other languages are tagged:

title: yakuzen_kusuri
body:
Character from [[Kimi no Koto ga Dai Dai Dai Dai Daisuki na 100-nin no Kanojo]]. [[Aijou Rentarou]]'s fifth girlfriend, and a [[mad scientist]].

She has [[aqua eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]] with [[antenna hair]]. She looks small due to a failed immortality drug, though it can be reversed for a short period of time using her negation drug.

She wears a [[lab coat]] instead of the blazer in her [[school uniform]], revealing [[suspenders]] attached to her skirt. 

Voiced by [[Asai Ayaka]].

h4. See also

title: yakuzen_kusuri_(older)
body:
[[Yakuzen Kusuri]]'s alternate form, who appears her true age of 18.

She has [[long hair]] and [[large breasts]], revealing a [[mole on breast|mole on her left breast]] due to her [[undersized clothes|clothes not being big enough for her]]. She usually also wears [[red-framed eyewear|red]] [[under-rim eyewear|under-rim]] [[glasses]].

title: yakuzen_yaku
body:
Character from [[Kimi no Koto ga Dai Dai Dai Dai Daisuki na 100-nin no Kanojo]]. [[Aijou Rentarou]]'s sixteenth girlfriend, and [[Yakuzen Kusuri]]'s grandmother.

She is actually 89 years old, but looks very young due to a failed immortality drug. Unlike her granddaughter, she is unable to revert to her true age, because her version of the drug was even more potent than Kusuri's.

title: amaryllis_(flower)
body:
A [[lily]]-like [[flower]] in the [i]Amaryllidaceae[/i] family. It can be distinguished from lilies by its umbrella-shaped inflorescence, bulkier petals, upturned stamens, and upright, strap-shaped leaves that emerge from the underground bulb.

The name [i]Amaryllis[/i] is mainly used for [i]Hippeastrum[/i] flowers.

title: onbashira
body:
[[Yasaka Kanako]]'s logs. The Onbashira are sacred logs that are used, after being cut using special ceremonial tools, in renewal of the Suwa Grand Shrine that occurs every six years, the ceremony which has gone uninterrupted for 1200 years. There are used in two festivals, Yamadashi and Satobiki. Yamadashi uses large trees that are covered in red and white regalia and covered in ropes. Part of this includes the ceremony on "Ki-Otoshi" which involves young men riding onbashira down steep slopes to prove their manhood.

Satobiki involves the ceremonial placement of onbashira in the foundations of the Suwa Grand Shrine, with a ceremonial group of log bearers that ride the log as its being raised and sing from the top of the log to signify that it has been raised.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Onbashira":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Onbashira

title: spider_lily
body:
A poisonous [[flower]] (species [i]Lycoris radiata[/i]) commonly associated with death. 

A spider lily has 4-6 flowers growing from a central leafless stem, forming a sort of dome. Natural colors include red (most common), pink, [[White spider lily|white]] and [[Yellow spider lily|yellow]], sometimes depicted in non-existent black and [[Blue spider lily|blue]]. The most noticeable features are the long stamens, which give it a distinct entangled/spidery look, earning its common English name 'Spider Lily'. 

Its Japanese name is "[i]Higan-bana[/i]" ("[i]Higan[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Higan flower) or "[i]Manjushage[/i]". It blooms without leaves and bears leaves without flowers, which is why it is also known in Japan as 葉見ず花見ず ([i]ha-mizu, hana-mizu[/i]), roughly translated as "without seeing leaves, without seeing flowers".

Not to be confused with [[chrysanthemum]], some species of which have long and thin outer petals that can resemble spider lily stamens.

h4. Examples

* !asset #21275986: Flower
* !asset #21275983: Plant
* !post #7637779

title: kamen_rider_dark_kiva
body:
[i]"This is my proclamation as king, rejoice"[/i]
―King issuing his death warrant

The Checkmate Four's original [b]King[/b] ([b]キング[/b] Kingu) was referred to as the first [b]Dark Kiva[/b] ([b]闇のキバ[/b] Yami no Kiba), the lord of all Fangires and the original Kiva who was a threat to humanity in his time. He was also known as the [b]Bat Fangire[/b] ([b]バットファンガイア[/b] Batto Fangaia), with his true name being The Dawn Sleeps, A Magnificent Story's Ending (暁が眠る、素晴らしき物語の果て Akatsuki ga Nemuru, Subarashiki Monogatari no Hate). He was from the Beast Class of the Fangire subclass.
other_names: 仮面ライダーダークキバ

title: kivat-bat_ii
body:
A mechanical-looking [[bat (animal)|]] from the television series [[Kamen Rider Kiva (series)|Kamen Rider Kiva]].

Formerly a part of the Checkmate Four's treasure in 1986, helping the King fight as [[Kamen Rider Dark Kiva|Dark Kiva]]. He arrived in 2008 and used [[Otoya Kurenai]] (much to the fact that he died after abusing its power) and [[Nobori Taiga]] (formerly [[Kamen Rider Saga]]).

It is then revealed in the series that he is the father of [[Kivat-Bat III]].

Voiced by [[Sugita Tomokazu]], who also voices Kivat-Bat III.

title: mimori_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Vice-president of the Inner Discipline Club. Her full name is Mizuha Mimori.

She has [[blue eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] tied into a  [[braided bun|braided]] [[single side bun]] held with a [[hair ribbon]] and a [[tassel hair ornament]] tied into a [[flower knot]], with [[sidelocks]] and [[swept bangs|swept]] [[double-parted bangs]].

Her regular outfit is a miko-themed [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[serafuku]] with a [[red sailor collar]], a [[chihaya (clothing)|]] (although it's often portrayed  as a simple [[cape]]), a red [[obi]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]]-length [[hakama short skirt]] with a [[waist bow]], a [[black pantyhose]], [[white socks|white]], [[tabi]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[okobo]].

title: miyu_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Sniper of SRT Special Academy's [[RABBIT Platoon (blue archive)|]].

She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] in a [[hime cut]]. In her default outfit she wears a [[blue serafuku]] with [[white pantyhose]]. She carries a Finnish variant of the [[Mosin-Nagant]] [[bolt action]] [[rifle]]. 

Often seen [[in trash can|inside a trash can]] with a few [[leaf|leaves]] [[leaf on head|on her head]] as an in-game joke on her bad body smell as a result of her spending most of her time reading without taking a bath, in addition to being her preferred [[sniper|sniping]] spot.

Her full name is Kasumizawa Miyu.

Voiced by: [[Gotou Yuuko]]
Original artist: [[YutokaMizu]]

h4. Appearance

title: azusa_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Ice witch of the [[Make-Up Work Club (blue archive)|]]. [spoiler]Former member of [[Arius Squad (blue archive)|]][/spoiler]. Her full name is Shirasu Azusa.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] with [[crossed bangs]] that reach [[hair between eyes|between the eyes]], [[purple eyes|purple]] to [[pink eyes]], [[low wings|low]] [[white wings|white]] [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[angel wings]], and a [[yellow halo|yellow]] [[crescent halo|crescent]] [[halo]]. She wears a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[black dress|black]] [[dress]] with [[dress flower|flower]] and [[petticoat]], [[hair flower]] and [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon|hair]] [[ribbon]], [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[neck ribbon|neck]] [[ribbon]], [[loose socks|loose]] [[frilled socks|frilled]] [[black socks|black]] [[socks]] with [[ankle flower]], [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]], [[black sailor collar|black]] [[sailor collar]], and a [[open jacket|open]] [[white jacket|white]] [[jacket]] with [[puffy long sleeves]]. Uses a white [[M4 Carbine]] with [[latin text|latin]] [[blackletter]] inscription.

Voiced by: [[Taneda Risa]]
Original artist: [[NAMYO]]

h4. Appearance

title: ako_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Executive officer of the [[Prefect Team (blue archive)|]]. Her full name is Amau Ako.

She has an [[aqua halo|aqua]] to [[blue halo|blue]] [[crescent halo]], [[medium hair|medium]] to [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]], and  [[large breasts]]. Her regular hairstyle has [[sidelocks]] going [[hair behind ear|behind her ears]] and [[hair over shoulder|over her shoulders]], [[double-parted bangs]] going [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]], and is decorated with a [[black hairband|black]] [[bow hairband]] with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]]. She wears black [[earrings]].

Her regular outfit consists of a [[white_shirt|white]] [[sideless_shirt|sideless]] [[collared shirt]] that exposes her [[sideboob]]s, a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[double-breasted]] [[blue jacket]] that goes [[framed breasts|around]] and [[underbust|under]] her breasts, a [[neck bell|neck]] [[cowbell]] , [[black gloves|black]] [[half gloves]], a [[shackles|shackle]] on her left wrist, a [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt|pencil]] [[miniskirt]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[black garter straps]], [[ankle strap]]s and [[black footwear|black]] [[platform footwear|platform shoes]] with [[colored shoe soles]].

Voiced by: [[Kouno Marika]]
Original artist: [[DoReMi_(doremi4704)]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #5484525: Default

title: eimi_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the Super Phenomenon Task Force and junior of the Millenium Science School.

An emotionally inscrutable oddball with an unique fashion sense. Her full name is Izumimoto Eimi. Her personal weapon is based on the Franchi [[SPAS-12]] [[shotgun]].

Voiced by: [[Matsunaga Akane]]

body:
Official [[swimsuit]] [[official_alternate_costume|alternate costume]] for [[eimi_(blue_archive)|Eimi]] from [[Blue Archive]]. Peculiarly, the skin was released in the middle of winter 2023, and as such Eimi is depicted wearing a mismatched outfit featuring winter-themed attire alongside a [[bikini]].
