title: hanae_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the Remedial Knights. Her full name is Asagao Hanae.

She has [[blue eyes]], a [[pink halo]], [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[purple hair]], tied into [[twintails]], decorated with [[hairclip]]s and [[crossed bandaids|crossed]] [[bandaid hair ornament|bandaid]] and [[pill hair ornament]]s, a [[skin fang]] and [[large breasts]].

Her regular outfit consists of a [[nurse cap]], a [[white choker]], a [[short dress|short]] [[black dress|black]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[white sailor collar]], a [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[pink jacket]] with an [[armband]] held with a [[safety pin]], [[mismatched_legwear|mismatched]] thighhighs (a [[pink_thighhighs|pink]] [[striped thighhighs|stripped]] one and a [[white_thighhighs|white]] one) a [[thigh holster|thigh]] [[syringe]] [[syringe holster|holster]] and [[mismatched footwear|mismatched]] shoes. She also carries a [[stuffed rabbit]].

Her personal weapon is an [[L85]] [[assault rifle]].

Voiced by: Kana Yuuki. 
Original artist: [[tonito]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #5442046: Default
* !post #6496286: [[Hanae (Christmas) (blue archive)|Christmas]]
* !asset #23215135: [[Hanae (Cheer Squad) (blue archive)|Cheer Squad]]

h4. External links

* "Blue Archive Wiki: Hanae":[https://bluearchive.wiki/wiki/Hanae]

title: hanae_(cheer_squad)_(blue_archive)
body:
[[official alternate costume|Official]] unplayable [[cheerleader]] costume for [[Hanae (blue_archive)|]] from [[Blue Archive]].

It consists of a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[visor cap]] a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[sailor shirt]] [[crop top]] with a [[white sailor collar]], a [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[waist bow]], [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[white thighhighs]] with one being one being [[frilled thighhighs|frilled]] and [[ribbon-trimmed legwear|ribbon-trimmed]] and [[blue_footwear|blue]] [[high tops]]. She also carries yellow [[pom pom (cheerleading)|]]s. Her [[official_alternate_hairstyle|hairstyle]] with this costume is a [[two side up]] with [[swept bangs]], decorated with an [[x hair ornament]]. She also has a [[heart stickers|heart sticker]] [[sticker on face|on her face]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #23215135

title: hanae_(christmas)_(blue_archive)
body:
[[official alternate costume|Official]] [[Christmas]] costume for [[Hanae (blue_archive)|]] from [[Blue Archive]].

It consists of a [[red headwear|red]] [[santa hat]] with [[fake antlers]], a [[red sweater|red]]  [[ribbed_sweater|ribbed]] [[turtleneck sweater]] with [[long_sleeves|long]] [[fur-trimmed sleeves]], [[red mittens]], a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]], [[white pantyhose]] and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[fur-trimmed boots|fur-trimmed]] [[ankle boots]]. She also carries a [[handbell]] and a [[sack]]. Her [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyle]] with this costume is [[low twintails]] with [[hairclip]], a [[heart hair ornament]] and [[mistletoe hair ornament|mistletoe-shaped]] [[hair bobbles]].

Voiced by: Kana Yuuki
Costume artist: [[kokosando]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #6496286

title: hanako_(swimsuit)_(blue_archive)
body:
A [[swimsuit]] [[official alternate costume|costume]] for [[Hanako (blue archive)|]]. Costume artist: [[mx2j]]

Due to the peculiar way Hanako's outfit was drawn (only her [[bikini]] top is visible under her [[white shirt]]), combined with the fact that her in-game chibi model [[bikini top only|does not appear to have a bikini bottom]], this resulted in fan artists drawing Hanako in this specific outfit as being [[bottomless]].

body:
A strange creature from [[Blue Archive]]. Nazomaki (Mystery Maki) is a surreal illustration of [[Maki (Blue Archive)|]] which appears in [[Chihiro (Blue Archive)|]]'s Recollection. title: faust_(blue_archive)
body:
The masked (by a [[paper bag]]) alter-ego of [[Hifumi_(Blue_Archive)|Hifumi]], and (supposed) leader of the Masked Swimsuit Gang. Named in reference to [[Faust_(Guilty_Gear)|the Guilty Gear character of the same name]] due to him also wearing a [[bag over head|bag on his head]].
Often portrayed in fanart as actually [i]being[/i] the ruthless influential kingpin people think she is.

title: mutsuki_face_(blue_archive)
body:
A [[meme]] based on a screenshot of a 3D model of [[Mutsuki_(blue_archive)|]] from [[Blue Archive]] that emphasizes her round face with a smug [[:3]] expression.

The model was part of a collaboration event between Blue Archive and the airsoft gun manufacturer Tokyo Marui. For this event a [[VRChat]] world was created for the online convention "Virtual Market 6":[https://vket6.v-market.work/en] featuring various models of weapons and characters and a playable shooting minigame.

h4. Examples

* !asset #20310852
* !asset #20149629

h4. External links

* "Virtual Market 6: TOKYO MARUI Co., Ltd":[https://vket6.v-market.work/en/company/3]
* "DCinside.com: I took a picture of the Blue Archive corporate booth in VR Chat":[https://gall.dcinside.com/mgallery/board/view/?id=projectmx&no=717279] ("Archive.is":https://archive.is/uFcfm)
* "VRChat: TOKYO MARUI VRC Survival Game Field ＂Island＂":[https://vrchat.com/home/launch?worldId=wrld_2a05d03b-de3f-4063-96ce-3835dfb3e56f]
* "Reddit: What's the origin of this Mutsuki image?":https://www.reddit.com/r/BlueArchive/comments/wolljn/whats_the_origin_of_this_mutsuki_image_ive_seen/

title: ayane_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Secretary of the [[Foreclosure Task Force (blue archive)|]]. Her full name is Okusora Ayane.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with a [[crown braid]] decorated with a [[hair flower]], [[yellow eyes]] and [[pointy ears]]. She wears [[red-framed eyewear|red-framed]] [[glasses]] and has a [[red halo]]. Her default outfit is a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[blazer]] with an [[armband]] and an [[id card]], a [[yellow vest|yellow]] [[sweater vest]] a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], an [[aqua necktie]], a [[plaid_skirt|plaid]] [[grey_skirt|grey]] [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and [[black_footwear|black]] [[loafers]].

Her personal weapon is a [[Sig P220/P226|SIG P220]] and she can deploy a [[drone]].

Voiced by: [[Harada Sayaka]]
Original artist: [[hwansang]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #5441135: Default
* !post #6496339: [[Ayane (Swimsuit) (blue archive)|Swimsuit]]

title: kisaki_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. The president of the Xuanlong Office and the student council president of the Shanhaijing Secondary School. Her full name is Ryuuge Kisaki.

She has a dragon-shaped [[halo]], [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[grey eyes]]. Her regular hairstyle consists of [[double bun]]s with a [[bun with braided base|braided base]] that turn into [[twintails]] held with [[butterfly hair ornament]]s. Her outfit consists of a [[short dress|short]] [[black dress|black]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[china dress]] with a [[back cutout]], a [[side slit]] a [[pelvic curtain]] and a [[dragon print|dragon]] [[print dress|print]], a [[grey coat|grey]] [[vertical-striped coat]] with [[pinstripe pattern]], [[black gloves|black]] [[half gloves]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[pumps]].

She's often drawn with her [[arms up]], performing the "Banzai stretch", which originated from episode 3 of the in-game event "Catch in Neverland":[https://bluearchive.fandom.com/wiki/Catch_in_Neverland].

Her weapon is based on the [[CS/LS06]] [[submachine gun]].

Original artist: [[yutokamizu]]
Voiced by Aisaka Yuuka

title: original
body:
Artwork depicting a subject that isn't from any established [[howto:copyright|copyright]]. Basically, art that is not fanart.

Some art may depict original subjects alongside subjects from an established copyright, or a fan-made character of a specific copyright. In this case, the art should be tagged as original and with the tag for the copyright and apply the tag [[oc x canon]].

If the artwork shows a [i]different artist's[/i] original character, include the [[borrowed character]] tag as well.

Some works on Pixiv are occasionally tagged original by accident. Art by the character designer for an established copyright also sometimes tag their work as original — on Danbooru, these should be tagged with the corresponding copyright instead.

h4. See also

* [[adoptable]]
* [[borrowed character]]
* [[commissioner insert]]
* [[copyright request]]
other_names: オリジナルキャラクター
オリフレ(けものフレンズ)

title: kemono_friends
body:
A Japanese multimedia franchise about the fictional [i]Japari Park[/i], where various animals—both real and mythological— have been [[personification|anthropomorphized]] into animal girls, referred to as [i]Friends[/i], by the mysterious power of a curious substance called [[Sandstar]].

Originally envisioned as a multimedia project, a mobile game published by Nexon was released in 2015, with a tie-in anime series set after the events of the game due to air some time later. The project was not without its turbulence, as the mobile game ended its services in late 2016—just one month before the anime aired in early 2017, the first season of which was financially restricted, resulting in poor animation quality and mixed reviews from initial critics and viewers.

Despite the 2015 game being closed down early—thus failing to give anime viewers context as had been planned—the anime was a surprise hit, due in no small part to scripting by director [[tatsuki (irodori)|Tatsuki]]; the show received very high ratings and viewership, miraculously reviving the dying franchise into a breakout success.

h4. Media under the franchise

h6. Anime

* TV anime series [i]Kemono Friends[/i] by [[yaoyorozu_(studio)|Yaoyorozu]] (Winter 2017)
* TV anime series [i][[Kemono Friends 2]][/i] by Tomason (Winter 2019)
* Original net anime [i]Welcome to the JAPARI PARK[/i] (2018-2020)

h6. Game

* Mobile RPG [i]Kemono Friends[/i] by [[Nexon]] (2015-2016)
* Mobile game [i][[Kemono Friends Pavilion]][/i] by Bushimo (2018-2021)
* Mobile RPG [i][[Kemono Friends Festival]][/i] by Goodroid (2018-2024)
* Mobile RPG [i][[Kemono Friends 3]][/i] by [[Sega]] (2019-)
* Arcade game [i][[Kemono Friends 3: Planet Tours]][/i] by [[Sega]] (2019-2021)
* Mobile RPG [i][[Kemono Friends Kingdom]][/i] (2022-)

h6. Stage play

* [i]Stage Play "Kemono Friends"[/i] by Nelke Planning (Jun. 2017 and Jan. 2018)
* [i]Anitele × =LOVE Stage Project "Kemono Friends"[/i] (Feb. 2018)
* [i]Stage Play "Kemono Friends" 2 ~Yuki Furu Yoru no Kemono-tachi~[/i] by Nelke Planning (Nov. 2018)
* [i]Stage Play " "[/i] by Nelke Planning (2019)

h6. Book

* Manga series [i]Kemono Friends -Youkoso Japari Park e!-[/i] by [[fly (marguerite)|Fly]] (2015-2016)
* Manga series [i]Kemono Friends 2[/i] by [[Naitou Ryuu]]
* Novel series [i]Kadokawa Tsubasa Bunko-ban Kemono Friends[/i] (2019)

h6. Other

* Fan-made anime project [i][[Kemono Friends R]][/i] (2020)
* [[Virtual YouTuber]] group [i][[Kemono Friends V Project]][/i] (2021-)

h4. See also
* [[List of Kemono Friends characters]]

title: plana_(blue_archive)
body:
A non-playable character in [[Blue Archive]]. Similar in appearance to [[Arona (Blue Archive)|]]. 

She has [[black eyes]] with [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] worn [[hair over one eye|over one eye]] and has [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair]]. She wears all black, including a [[black serafuku]], [[black coat|coat]], [[black pantyhose|pantyhose]], [[black choker|choker]], and [[black hairband|hairband]], with a [[white neckerchief]]. Like [[Arona (Blue Archive)|]], she has [[mismatched pupils]]: her right pupil is [[blue pupils|blue]] while her left pupil is [[pink pupils|pink]].

[spoiler]Originally referred to as A.R.O.N.A., she is later renamed "Plana" by [[Arona (blue archive)|]] after the events of the Final Chapter, once she decides to join [[Sensei (Blue Archive)|]] and cohabitate in the Shittim Chest with [[Arona (blue archive)|]].[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Kohara Konomi]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #21310314: Default

h4. External links

* "Blue Archive Wiki: Plana":[https://bluearchive.fandom.com/wiki/Plana]

body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Former Vice President of the Abydos Student Council and leader of the [[Foreclosure Task Force (blue archive)|]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[pink hair]] with a [[huge ahoge]] and [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] [[blue eyes|blue]] and [[yellow eyes]]. In her default outfit she wears a [[black skirt|black]] [[plaid skirt]], a white [[collared shirt]] with a [[chest harness]], and a [[blue necktie]]. She is equipped with a [[Beretta 1301]] [[shotgun]] and a [[suitcase]] that can turn into a [[ballistic shield]].

In later stories, she has turned herself into "Combat Mode" alongside with a Pistol and Shield.

Her full name is Takanashi Hoshino.

title: arona_(blue_archive)
body:
A non-playable character from [[Blue Archive]]. [[Sensei (blue archive)|]]'s virtual assistant residing in the Shittim Chest.

She is the main mascot of Blue Archive, appearing as the figurehead on its website and social media. In addition to providing information and updates to Sensei, she also runs a series of videos called Arona Channel, as well as being the one who is representing the in-game [[gacha (game mechanic)|]] mechanics.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[light blue hair|blue hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair|undertones]], worn [[hair over one eye|over one eye]]. She has [[mismatched pupils]]: her right pupil is [[blue pupils|blue]] while her left pupil is [[pink pupils|pink]].

Voiced by [[Kohara Konomi]]

title: hiyama_kiyoteru
body:
Hiyama Kiyoteru is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by AH-Software Co. Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. 

His appearance was illustrated by [[Umetani Atarou]]. He is designed as a young teacher. He ends up teaching mathematics to [[Kaai Yuki]]. And according to his official profile, he is part of a band called "ICE MOUNTAIN" where he plays guitar and vocals as "Ice Teru". 

He wears a standard [[suit]] with blue [[necktie|tie]], and has [[glasses]] and a blue [[headset]]. His hair is [[brown hair|brown]] and his eyes are [[black eyes|black]].

h4. See also

title: kamen_rider_accel
body:
Secondary Rider of [[Kamen Rider W]].

[[Terui RYuu|Terui Ryu]] is a young police superintendent in charge of investigating paranormal crimes. However, he loathes his host city, and only does his job to find the "[[Isaka Shinkuro|Man]] with the [[Weather Dopant|W]] [[Gaia Memory|Memory]]", who killed his family.

Unlike [[Kamen Rider Double|Double]], Ryu only needs himself to turn into Accel, a red Rider with the ability to transform into a motorcycle. He also has the ability to transform into the blue, speed-oriented Trial Form, as well as the all-around Booster Form but only in W Returns.
other_names: 仮面ライダーアクセル

title: kamen_rider_nega_den-o
body:
The main villain of the [[Kamen Rider Den-O (series)|Kamen Rider Den-O]] & [[Kamen Rider Kiva (series)|Kiva]]: Climax Deka movie.

He is the Rider form of [[Negataros]], who looks exactly like [[Kamen Rider Den-O]] Sword Form, except that his [[peach]]-themed armor plates are colored purple with cyan tribal markings that also appear on the gloves and the boots of his Rider suit.

He only has one form called Nega Form. He can also alter the Nega DenGasher into any of Den-O's various weapons.
other_names: 仮面ライダーネガ電王

title: bb_(swimsuit_mooncancer)_(third_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[bb (swimsuit mooncancer) (fate)|BB Swimsuit MoonCancer]] in her Third Ascension swimsuit from [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Her hairstyle returns to normal, but the hair length grows significantly longer. She wears a black vampire-styled coat with a large popped collar, a [[white leotard]], a red bowtie, [[white gloves]], and red [[high heels]]. She is also accompanied by a series of demonic black, red and yellow tentacles [spoiler]due to the connection she made with Nyarlathotep[/spoiler]. She always wears this Ascension's swimsuit during her Noble Phantasm, Cursed Cutting Crater. While she is more playful in her first two Ascensions, she is evil in this one.

This tag can include her tanned and non-tanned variants.

title: camazotz_(fate)
body:
An NPC introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s South American Lostbelt. The Mayan bat god of the underworld. He is responsible for forcing the aspects of [[Xochitonal (fate)|]] onto [[Kingprotea (fate)|]], turning [[Beni-enma]] into [[Beni-enma Alter]], and turning [[Ereshkigal (fate)|]] into [[ereshkigal alter (fate)|Ninkigal]], making them enemies against Chaldea. [spoiler]He is revealed to be [[camazotz (beast i:lost) (fate)|Beast I:Lost]], a human king with the moniker "The King of Braves", a nod to his voice actor (see below) who had taken all of humanity's sacrifice to gain immortality and Beasthood in order to defeat [[ORT (type-moon)|]].[/spoiler]

Designed by [[routo]] and voiced by [[Hiyama Nobuyuki]].

title: philip_(kamen_rider)
body:
The right half of [[Kamen Rider Double]].

An eccentric young man of mysterious origin. Philip works with [[Hidari Shoutarou]] by acting as a sort of living search engine with access to all information in the known world. He spends most of his time inside the Narumi Detective Agecy's secret garage often researching anything he does not know about yet.

His gaia memories are Cyclone, Heat, Luna, and the sentient Fang.

title: momose_ginko
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[Cerise Bouquet]] from the 104th class. 

She is a girl who loves tradition. [[momose ginko's grandmother|Her grandmother]] was a member of the Performing Arts Club, which later became the School Idol Club. As a Kanazawa native, she sometimes slips into the [[kanazawaben|Kanazawa dialect]] out of surprise. She defaults to it when speaking with her family.

She has [[green eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[green hair|green]]-ish [[black hair]] styled in a [[blunt ends|blunt]] [[bob cut]] and [[blunt bangs]] with a [[hair flower]] and [[flower knot]] on her left.

She wears [[black pantyhose]] with her [[hasu no sora school uniform|school uniform]].

Voiced by [[Sakurai Hina]].

title: caldari_state_(eve_online)
body:
One of the four major factions in [[EVE Online]].
Founded on the tenets of patriotism and hard work that carried its ancestors through hardships on an inhospitable homeworld, the Caldari State is today a corporate dictatorship, led by rulers who are determined to see it return to the meritocratic ideals of old. Ruthless and efficient in the boardroom as well as on the battlefield, the Caldari are living emblems of strength, persistence, and dignity.

The home planet of the Caldari is [[Caldari Prime (EVE Online)|]] in the system of Luminaire. Gallente prime, the home planet of the Gallente, is located in the same system.
[spoilers]The Caldari were once part of the [[Gallente Federation (EVE Online)|]]. Soon after the technology for interstellar travel was rediscovered in Gallente Federation the Caldari corporations started secret colonization of their own. Once the Gallente Federation found out about these colonies the Federation of course demanded that they are put under the authority of the Federation. The Caldari corporations declined. The relationships were tense and Caldari Prime was put under blockade. Eventually, Caldari partisans in Caldari Prime sabotaged an underwater Gallente city. The Gallente retaliated with orbital bombardment and the Gallente-Caldari [[war]] began. The war lasted for a hundred years until the newly formed [[CONCORD Assembly (EVE Online)|CONCORD]] was finally able to negotiate peace between the two factions. Caldari Prime is still under Gallente control to this day and the relationships between Gallente and Caldari are very bad.[/spoilers]

Favor [[missile]]s and Hybrid [[Turret]]s. Prioritize [[energy barrier|shields]] over speed.

h5. External links: 
https://universe.eveonline.com/empires/caldari
https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Caldari_State

title: shylily_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Shylily]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/2wintails/status/1481083511989673986].

She wears an [[animal hood|orca hood]] with a [[serafuku|white see-through serafuku]] and a [[skirt|blue skirt]], paired with a [[bikini|blue halterneck bikini]] which she wears [[bikini under clothes|underneath]]. (There is [[shylily (bikini)|a separate costume tag]] for when she's only wearing the bikini part.) She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with a [[asymmetrical_hair|single long strand on her left side]], and [[brown_eyes|brown]] [[tsurime]] eyes. h4. History
The historical IJN [i]I-13[/i] had a severely short history, being commissioned only on December 16, 1944, and sunk by USS [i]Anzio[/i] on July 16, 1945 while en route to an operation. Her [[dark persona|abyssal counterpart]] ([[Abyssal Twin Princess (white)]]) is also presumed killed by the player in her final form and it references the real life I-13's fate.

title: oshi-katsu
body:
The act of stans supporting their favorite [[idol]] or character. A form of [[otaku]] activities (ota-katsu), seen commonly among high school girls and young women. They can be distinguished from standard otaku as their nerdiness is centered on a single individual.

The word is used for someone being extremely dedicated to supporting their favorite - the object of their affection is their "oshi". (while "katsu" is short for [i]katsudou[/i] - activities)

Most commonly shown through having tons of merchandise of a single idol or character, or through typical idol fan behavior. [[Jirai kei]] girls frequently practice oshi-katsu.

h4. Examples

* !post #7282841: A jirai kei girl with an [[itabag]]
* !post #8305371: Fans cheering on an idol
* !post #7171652: Room decor based on one's oshi
* !post #5370485: Showing off merchandise

h4. See also

title: hk_slap
body:
A method of releasing the charging handle from the notch of a firearm, particular ones located at the front of the weapon. This action is mainly done on firearms featuring a roller delayed blowback system, since the roller requires the bolt to travel forward with some force to properly lock.

The action is mainly associated with [[Heckler & Koch]] firearms, including the [[h&k_mp5|MP5]], the [[h&k_g3|G3]], and the [[h&k_ump|UMP]], as the manufacturer recommends this action in its operator manuals.

title: silver_surfer
body: The Silver Surfer is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. The character also appears in a number of movies, television, and video game adaptations. The character was created by Jack Kirby and first appeared in the comic book [[Fantastic Four]] #48, published in 1966.

title: perth_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s depiction of HMAS Perth (D29), drawn by [[Kusada Souta]]. HMAS Perth was one of three modified Leander-class light cruisers used by the Royal Australian Navy during the early part of [[World War II]]. She was originally called HMS Amphion before being renamed after "the capital city of the state of Western Australia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perth]. She is the game's first Australian shipgirl.

Visually, Perth has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied in a [[braided bun]] with a [[braid]] across the front. She wears a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] underneath a [[green vest]] with a [[blue necktie]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[plaid skirt]], a pair of [[green thighhighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. Her [[machinery]] includes a pair of [[adapted turret]]s and a [[searchlight]]. She also has a [[green cape]] draped over her left shoulder, fastened by a large [[badge]] that strangely resembles the [[Icelandic flag]] and six seven-pointed stars which resemble those found on the Australian flag.

Because she is originally British, she does not exhibit the stereotypical mannerisms and preferences associated with Australians. She does make a reference to "Vegemite":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vegemite], a popular Australian sandwich spread, and is often accompanied by a [[koala]] in fan art (due to one clinging to a fairy version of her, the 6-inch Twin Rapid Fire Gun Mount Mk.XXI fairy).

She was originally commissioned for the [[Royal Navy]] on 15 June 1936 and was sold to the Royal Australian Navy in June 1939. She was sunk during the Battle of Sunda Strait on 1 March 1942.

h4. See Also
* [[list of Kantai Collection characters]]
* Her Leander-class half-sisters:
** [[Leander (Azur Lane)|]]
** [[Ajax (Azur Lane)|]]
** [[Achilles (Azur Lane)|]]

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: HMAS Perth (D29)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMAS_Perth_(D29)]

title: traumatized
body:
A character in the process of or after experiencing some “traumatic” event (ex: betrayal, seeing [[death]], etc.) that would cause that character to experience [[PTSD]] if reminded of the experience in the future.

A possible indication of a character being traumatized is an expression of shock with [[empty eyes]] (though it is not limited to such features).

A picture tagged with this tag should show/imply the cause of the trauma and that the character has a negative reaction towards whatever event is the cause.

h4. See Also
* [[despair]]
* [[ruined for marriage]]

title: guy_tired_after_sex_(meme)
body:
A redraw [[meme]] based on a picture of a man apparently [[exhausted]] with [[sunken cheeks]] in bed while his girlfriend takes a [[selfie]] above him. Some interpreted the photo as an implication the pair had [[after sex|just had sex]]. The photo became a template with which people drew original characters and characters from pop culture in their poses.

* !asset #24740426

There is also a trend of combining this meme with other desiccated body memes, such as the [[mexico_ufo_alien_bodies_hearing_(meme)|Mexican UFO Alien]].
h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Guy Tired After Sex":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/guy-tired-after-sex

title: h.e.r.b.i.e.
body:
[b]H.E.R.B.I.E.[/b] (Humanoid Experimental Robot, B-type, Integrated Electronics) is a [[robot]] from the [[Fantastic Four]]. 

It was originally created for the 1978 Fantastic Four cartoon on NBC (now known as The New Fantastic Four) as a replacement for [[Johnny Storm]], as the character's television rights were owned by Universal Studios at the time and they were planning a live action television movie of the [[Human Torch]]. H.E.R.B.I.E. has since appeared in the comics and later adaptations.

body:

A former [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]], part of [[hololive English]]'s [[holoCouncil|2nd]] [[holoPromise|generation]]. The keeper of the Earth's nature, she's a [[qilin (mythology)|]] girl who was born at the same time of Earth's creation and became its guardian. Designed by [[Toosaka Asagi]]. She graduated from hololive on January 3rd, 2025.

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] with a [[gradient hair|gradient]] towards dark green and dark green [[streaked hair|streaks]] and small [[hair flower]]. She also has [[antlers]], [[yellow eyes]], [[large breasts]], and a [[mole under eye|mole under her right eye]]. Her default hairstyle consists of a [[one side up]] with [[long bangs|long]] [[asymmetrical bangs]] with one side being [[braided bangs|braided]] and the other [[hair over one eye|covering her left eye]].

title: mature_female
body:
An attractive "middle-aged" woman. Common traits include slight [[mature eyes|face]] [[wrinkled skin|wrinkles]], a noticeable [[belly]], and an overall body shape that's generally [[curvy|curvier]] than that of a younger woman. Alternate terms, depending on age range, can include cougar, hag, or MILF ([b]M[/b]other [b]I[/b]'d [b]L[/b]ike to [b]F[/b]uck; used regardless of the fact whether she's had children or not).

A woman that is said to be a mother or shown with her own children does not automatically make her a mature female. She must [i]look[/i] like an older woman to count.

body:
1967 [[Hanna-Barbera]] cartoon based on the [[Fantastic Four]]. In Japan, it was known as "Uchuu Ninja Golmes", with the Fantastic Four being the "Uchuu Ninja Shiningumi" (宇宙忍者四人組, Space Ninja Quartet) and Golmes referring to [[Reed Richards]]' name in the dub (derived from 'gomu', referring to his rubber body, and 'Holmes'). The remaining Fantastic Four also had different names, with [[Sue Storm]] being called Susie, [[Johnny Storm]] being called Fireboy, and [[Ben Grimm]] being called Gunlock [with his catchphrase becoming 'Monsieur Muramura!', a signature of seiyuu Seki Keiroku]).

The villains were famously handled by comedians, with [[Doctor Doom]] (known here as Akuma Hakase/Dr. Demon) speaking in [[Nagoyaben]].

title: malice_(sue_storm)
body:
A villainous alternate persona of [[Sue Storm]], awakened in her by Psycho-Man. Malice gained increased popularity in 2025, when Sue Storm was added to [[Marvel Rivals]] with her Malice persona being included as a [[official alternate costume|playable skin]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24738918

title: sue_storm
body:
A member of the [[Fantastic Four]], known as the Invisible Woman. She has the power to generate forcefields, which she can use for a variety of purposes, including bending light to make anything invisible. She's [[Johnny Storm]]'s older sister, and she would later marry [[Reed Richards]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24738919: [[Marvel Rivals]]
* !asset #24738918: [[Malice (Sue Storm)|]]
other_names: インビジブルウーマン
スーザン・リチャーズ

title: cheating_(relationship)
body:
Cheating, in a sexual sense, is having sex with someone other than one's regular partner in a monogamous relationship. When this happens among married people, this is known as adultery. This can also apply to meeting another without the regular partner knowing.

For the act of using dishonest means to win a competition or similar, see [[cheating_(competitive)|cheating (competitive)]].
h4. Example
* !post #8098370

h4. See also

* [[Netorare]]
* [[Netorase]]
* [[Paternity fraud]]
* [[Swinging (relationship)]]

title: ruined_for_marriage
body:
[i]"Now I'll never be a bride..."[/i]

Refers to a stock situation where a character (conventionally female) experiences distress, because they have been in some way shamed or made 'impure,' and because of that can no longer get married.  The nature of the shame can be anything from being seduced or [[rape]]d, to being seen in [[underwear]] or [[nude]], to simply being caught in some [[embarrassed|embarrassing]] act (example: post #1282220).

This tag is appropriate when a character utters an appropriate version of the stock line "Now I can never be married..."  The situation is also frequently indicated non-verbally, through one character (the "aggressor") being shown [[smoking]] a [[after sex|post-coital]] [[cigarette]] with a satisfied expression on their face, while the other character (the "victim") is [[crying]], most often [[covering face|hiding their face]].

h4. See also

* [[after sex]]
* [[netorare]]

title: manjuu_abuse_(azur_lane)
body: A running gag in [[Azur Lane]] where the mascot [[Manjuu (azur_lane)|]] is "abused" (in a good way) by a shipgirl, such as being [[sitting on animal|sat on]], [[stepped on]], [[scissorhold|squished]], [[breast smother|smothered]], cooked, knocked out, shot out of a cannon, etc.

title: playboy_pokemon
body:
For images containing outfits that follow the general design of a [[playboy_bunny]], but designed after specific [[pokemon]]. Not exclusive to "bunny" pokemon.
Gijinka and furries of pokemon count as long as their outfit has the overall design of a playboy bunny outfit, but not if the outfit includes accesories like generic bunny ears instead of pokemon features.
In other words, images that act as an answer to: "What if the playboy bunny outfit were invented in the pokemon world, based on pokemon?"

title: falconry
body: Using a trained bird of prey to hunt small animals, or just having such a bird on one's arm. Often requires the use of a [[falconry glove]]. Though the name implies [[falcon]]s, the tag can include anything, including but not limited to [[hawk]]s, [[eagle]]s, [[harpy|harpies]], [[chimera|chimerae]], or [[airplane]]s.

title: commentary_request
body:
A post with an artist [[commentary]] that has not been fully translated into English.

To translate the commentary, click the [b]Add commentary[/b] link and place the translated title and commentary inside their respective fields. When the translation is complete, remove this tag and replace it with [[commentary]]. If the translation is incomplete or needs review, leave the [[commentary request]] tag and add the [[partial commentary]] or [[check commentary]] tags.

Do not tag an image as [[translation request]] when the commentary is untranslated. [[Translation request]] is for text inside the image.

h4. See Also

* [[commentary]]
* [[check commentary]]
* [[english commentary]]
* [[translation request]]
* [[help:artist_commentary]]
* [[howto:translate]]

title: partially_translated
body:
A post that has been partially translated with notes.

Partially translated posts should be tagged [[translation request]], not [[translated]].

h4. Related tags

* [[translated]]

h4. See also

title: flora_(pop'n_music)
body:
[i]Born in the Sunny Park full of everyone's smiles, the clover-like girl carries happiness.[/i]

An upbeat forest [[nymph|spirit]] who is heavily associated with animals. She wears a cotton [[headwreath]] and hates winter.

title: bob_2002_(pop'n_music)
body: A [[robot]] from Pop'n 9, he has a [[jetpack]] and goes [[sledding]] in his spare time. Hate [[crow]]s because they tend to peck at him while he flies.

title: dino_(pop'n_music)
body: [[Pop'n Music]] character. A [[dinosaur]] who rules the Märchen Kingdom. Close friends of Henry, prince of a neighboring kingdom. Dino loves video games and is a big fan of the [[Beatmania]] series. Sometimes he appears with a [[crown]] or a [[wizard hat]].

title: sunny_(pop'n_music)
body:
[i]Hello! I've been traveling around
 the world in search of my older brother!
 But I'm happy to have made a lot of friends! [/i]

A nomadic girl traveling the world for her brother. She no longer knows where she's from or where she's going to, but she enjoys the journey.

title: kuranosuke_(pop'n_music)
body:
[i]"A young boss who aims to unify the world with one Japanese sword! Even if he looks like this, he likes banquets and his stories are interesting, so he is respected by his subordinates."[/i]

A [[yakuza]] member who is well respected by his underlings. Older than most of the [[Pop'n Music]] cast. he has many [[piercing]]s.

title: foxy_(pop'n_music)
body: A cool [[fox boy]] from the Yokohama Warehouse District. He has [[sharp teeth]] and plays the [[saxophone]].

title: papyrus_(pop'n_music)
body: An [[Anubis]]-like creature who doesn't speak in a language others can understand. He is visually associated with [[hieroglyphics]].

title: pop'n_music
body:
Pop'n Music (ポップンミュージック), most commonly shortened to Pop'n, PM or PNM, is a music video game in [[Konami]]'s [[Bemani]] series. 

h4. See also

* [[List of BEMANI characters]]

h4. External links

* "Pop'n Music Wiki":https://popnmusic.fandom.com

title: mogiki_toaka
body:
The protagonist of [[aden_(game)|Aden]]
She is a cheerful lady who defeats enemies with the power of dance, learned from her friend [[sonikami kobako|kobako]]
Whom she meets quite suddenly, crashing onto her dancing stage during a performance. 
She has no memories of her past, or why she fell from the sky.

title: base_(art)
body:
An image designed to be edited, often posted for free on websites like [[DeviantART]]. In the 2000s, pixel bases traced from anime screenshots were commonplace, featuring nude and bald anime characters that artists (especially young artists) could edit their own hair and clothes onto.

Sometimes depicted as a nostalgic reference.

h4. See also

* [[derivative work]]
* [[2000s (style)]]

title: syuen_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. The cunning CEO of Missilis industry, notorious for her persuasive and arrogant demeanor to everyone, even at her company's own Nikkes, thinking them as nothing more than scrap heaps.

She's a [[petite]] girl with [[purple eyes]], [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[short hair|short]] [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[black hair|black]]/[[purple hair]], she also has a [[mole under eye]]. She wears [[gold earrings]], [[hair ribbon]], a [[short necktie|short]] [[purple necktie]], a [[multicolored shirt]], [[skirt]], a [[purple coat]] she wears [[off shoulder]], and has a [[leg tattoo|tattoo on her right leg]].

title: holocouncil
body:
[b]hololive English -Council-[/b], shortened as [b]holoCouncil[/b], is the second generation of [[hololive English]]. The lore of this generation is that each member is an avatar of a particular aspect of the universe: specifically Space, Earth/Nature, Time, Civilization, and Chaos.

Council originally consisted of [[Hakos Baelz]], [[Ouro Kronii]], [[Nanashi Mumei]], [[Ceres Fauna]], and [[Tsukumo Sana]], until the graduation of [[Tsukumo Sana]] on July 31, 2022.

Council frequently collabed with and became heavily associated with [[IRyS (hololive)|]], who debuted only one month prior. The five-plus-one members became known as an unofficial subunit dubbed CouncilRyS. Following the graduation of [[Tsukumo Sana]], the remaining CouncilRyS members were reorganized into an official unit named [[holoPromise]].

Use this tag when Bae, Kronii, Mumei, Fauna, and optionally Sana and IRyS (or their respective mascots) are deliberately grouped together. Use holoPromise when Bae, Kronii, Mumei, Fauna, and IRyS are grouped together.

title: tatsumi_koutarou
body:
The self proclaimed mysterious manager of the idol group Franchouchou in [[Zombie Land Saga]].

He has [[brown hair]], always wears [[sunglasses]] even during night time, and also wears his [[jacket on shoulders|jacket hanging on his shoulders]] and [[dried squid]] hanging off of the [[breast pocket]] of his [[red vest]]. His appearance is more or less likely based off of his voice actor, [[Miyano Mamoru]], who has made several appearances in-character within promotion.

While he generally treats the girls with a jerk-like attitude, it is made clear throughout that he does indeed care for the girls; particularly [[Minamoto Sakura|Sakura]]. In Episode 12, it is revealed that [spoiler]his real name is Inui, with strong implications that he had a crush on Sakura who was his classmate prior to her death in 2008[/spoiler].

title: multiple_views
body:
Two or more different pictures of the same character in an image. These can be the same character from different viewpoints, in different outfits, in different poses, or any combination.

This tag doesn't apply to [[zoom layer]] unless the zoom layer image is different from the foreground image. It also doesn't apply to [[comic]]s, as they generally always have multiple views.

Images with this tag should not be tagged [[solo]].

For depictions of characters that feature a duplicate of themselves, see the [[dual persona]] and [[clone]] tags.

title: vucub_(fate)
body: One of the inhabitants of [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s South American Lostbelt. He's a member of the [[dinosaur]]-like Deinos race and looks like a humanoid [[pterosaur]] dressed as a Bhuddist monk and carrying a ceremonial staff.

title: deinonychus_brother_(fate)
body:
Inhabitants of [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s South American Lostbelt. There are 11 "brothers", which are all members of the [[dinosaur]]-like Deinos race and look like deinonychus wearing ornaments, with only three different designs. They aren't referred to with individual names in the story, but as "Deinonychus Brothers 11", despite that, as a joke, not all of them are necessarily present at all times and they aren't strictly biological siblings.

They have a xokta (soccer) team named Death Rolling.

title: nesoberi
body:
A line of [[stuffed toy]]s, initially made for [[Love Live!]], but that has since expanded to other franchises too. "Nesoberi" (寝そべり) literally means '[[lying|to lie down]]' or 'to sprawl'.

They are primarily manufactured by SEGA and distributed through resellers or as game prizes. They come in multiple sizes, from miniature sizes that can barely fit in the palm of your hand, all the way to Mega Jumbo size that are over a foot long and a headsize high. There have also been a few examples of Tera Jumbo Nesoberi for the cast of [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]], which can cover half of a whole bedlength.

A game based upon the Nesoberis was released for Japanese Exclusive mobile devices in 2018: [[Puchiguru Love Live!]]. The game didn't last long and was shut down at the end of May in 2019. 

h4. Franchises

* [[Love Live!]]

body:

Vesta is at least [[tall female|two meters tall]]. She has light [[dark skin|brown skin]], [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]], and [[red eyes]]. She has long limbs, making her look like a model. Vesta's most notable feature of her body is that her [[huge breasts|breasts are larger than her head]]. She has [[long legs]], [[thick thighs]] and [[wide hips]]. Like all [[dragon girl|dragonkin]], she has slight [[spikes|protrusions]] coming out of the outer part of her forearms. Her main outfit is a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]] that shows off most of her enormous bosom.

title: gakuen_idolmaster
body:
An extension of the [[idolmaster|iDOLM@STER]] franchise, in the form of an idol raising simulation mobile game developed by QualiArts of [[IDOLY PRIDE]] fame. It was released on May 16, 2024. It centers around the Idol Department of Hatsuboshi Gakuen, where the idols consider each other rivals striving to become the number one idol. title: sword
body:
A bladed [[weapon]] designed for cutting or thrusting. They are typically composed of a hilt and a blade with one or two edges that can be straight or curved; most, but not all, swords have a pointed tip. The hilt, in turn, consists of a guard, a grip, and in most designs a pommel. The guard can be a crossguard like in a typical knight's sword, a disc like the [i]tsuba[/i] of a katana, or some more complex design.

It is a weapon strongly associated with elite warriors such as [[knight]]s and [[samurai]].

title: atri-my_dear_moments-
body:
Atri: My Dear Moments (stylized as ATRI-My Dear Moments-) is a 2020 visual novel game developed by Frontwing and Makura (枕) who are especially known for creating [[Grisaia No Kajitsu|The Fruit of Grisaia]] visual novel, written by Asuta Konno who also wrote the [[Kono Oozora ni Tsubasa wo Hirogete|If My Heart Had Wings]] visual novel and published by Aniplex.exe, a brand of Japanese anime and music production company [[Aniplex]]. The visual novel was digitally released on Steam for Windows on June 19, 2020 worldwide. Later, on December 16, 2021, the game was also released for Android, iOS and Nintendo Switch devices by iMel only in Japan.

h4. Synopsis
In the near future, a sudden rise in sea levels floods the majority of the world and ends human civilization as we know it, forcing humanity to eke a living on what little dry land remains. [[Ikaruga Natsuki]] is a young man living under difficult circumstances in this new world. He has lost one of his legs in an accident which can only be replaced with a crude prosthetic, and he suffers constant bouts of phantom pain. One day, though, Natsuki rummages through his recently deceased grandmother's belongings to pay off a debt, only to awaken a young android girl named [[Atri]], who will go on to change his life forever

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atri:_My_Dear_Moments

title: ichinose_uruha_(6th_costume)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[VSPO!]]'s [[Ichinose Uruha]], as seen in post #7436588.

The costume turns her into a [[demon girl|demon]] [[school uniform|schoolgirl]], with her attire consisting of a [[grey jacket|grey]] [[blazer]], worn over a [[dress shirt]], with a [[houndstooth]] print, [[grey necktie]] and a [[black collar]], a houndstooth printed, [[black skirt|black]], [[pleated skirt|pleated]], [[miniskirt]], [[loose socks]] and [[loafers]]. Demonic additions are, [[black horns|black]] to [[blue horns|blue]], [[gradient horns|gradient]], [[demon horns]], [[black wings|black]] to [[blue wings|blue]], [[gradient wings|gradient]], [[mini wings|mini]], [[demon wings]], and a [[black tail|black]] to [[blue tail|blue]], [[gradient tail|gradient]], [[demon tail]].

h4. External links
* "Costume reveal stream":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UxMmebChE1o

title: nurikabe
body:
The nurikabe (ぬりかべ) is a youkai that manifests as a wall that impedes or misdirects walking travelers at night. It is also a binary determination puzzle named after the youkai.

It is impossible to go over or around it as it has the ability to expand itself forever. It is said the only way to get past it is to knock on it's leg or lower part. 

It's known to be more annoying than bad or scary.

h4. See also

* [[Nurikabe (gegege no kitarou)|]] ([[Gegege no Kitarou]]), one of the more famous examples.
* [[Makabe Konuri]] ([[Petopetosan]])
* [[Murikabe]] ([[Youkai watch]])
* [[Nurikabe costume]]
* [[Traditional youkai]]

title: zenless_zone_zero
body:
An action role-playing video game developed by [[miHoYo]]. Released on July 4, 2024.

Set in a post-apocalyptic setting of the city of New Eridu, the player takes the role of [[Wise (zenless zone zero)|]] or [[Belle (zenless zone zero)|]], the sibling "Proxy" agents collectively known as "Phaethon" as they work with gangs, companies, and law enforcement for various tasks.

title: mindscape_cinema_(zenless_zone_zero)
body:
A game mechanic in [[Zenless Zone Zero]] that provides succeeding upgrades to playable characters. 

It typically features an illustration that changes with each upgrade. By the third upgrade, the illustration will be fully colored, and with each subsequent upgrade, the outfit depicted will change — with a few exceptions.

h4. See also
* [[all-out attack]] - a visually similar effect from [[Persona]]

h4. External links
* "Zenless Zone Zero Wiki - Mindscape Cinema":https://zenless-zone-zero.fandom.com/wiki/Mindscape_Cinema

title: japanese_clothes
body:
Any variety of traditional Japanese clothing. This excludes modern Japanese fashion, such as [[lolita fashion]] and [[school uniform]]s like [[serafuku]] and [[gakuran]].
H4. Clothes

* !post #2729999:  [[mizu happi]] [tn]| A combination of a [[happi]] coat and [[fundoshi]] (underwear).[/tn]
* !post #7168082:  [[montsuki]] [tn]| A men's attire for special occasions (black being the most formal color among them). It must feature a mon (family emblem).[/tn]
* !post #3464471:  [[samue]] [tn]| A simple outfit originally worn by Japanese Zen Buddhist for manual work.[/tn]
* !post #7099410:  [[sokutai]] [tn]| Formal court clothing.[/tn]

Voiced by [[Ookuma Wakana]].

title: raccoon_girl
body:
Girls with intrinsic raccoon or tanuki (raccoon-dog) features. Confusion between the two species means that characters who are meant to be tanuki girls have features more pertaining to the raccoon (like a ringed tail) and vice versa.

h4. See also

* [[raccoon]]
* [[raccoon ears]]
* [[raccoon tail]]
* [[tanuki]]

title: raccoon_tail
body:
Use this tag if a character has a [[tail]] resembling a [[raccoon]]'s or a [[tanuki]]'s.

While there are differences between a raccoon tail and a tanuki tail (raccoon tails are ringed but actual tanuki tails are tipped), they are often conflated with each other to the point where many characters who are supposed to be tanuki are depicted with ringed tails (thus, why raccoon and tanuki tails are consolidated into a single tag).

h4. See also

* [[raccoon ears]]

title: the_pillows
body:
A Japanese alternative rock band formed in 1989 in [[Hokkaido]], [[Japan]] and disbanded on January 31st 2025. The [[band (music)|]] consists of members Sawao Yamanaka (vocals and [[guitar]]), Yoshiaki Manabe (guitar), Shinichiro Sato ([[bass guitar]]), and Jun Suzuki ([[drum|drums]]).

The Pillows gained popularity in Japan in the mid-1990s with their unique blend of punk, indie rock, and pop music, and became known for their catchy hooks, energetic live performances, and Sawao Yamanaka's distinctively raspy vocals. They are perhaps best known in the West for their music featured in the anime series "[[FLCL]]" (Fooly Cooly), for which they composed and performed the entire soundtrack.

Over the years, The Pillows have released numerous albums and singles, and have become one of the most influential and respected bands in the Japanese rock scene. Their music has been described as a mix of punk rock, power pop, and garage rock, with influences mainly from British and American rock bands.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: The Pillows":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Pillows]

title: acheron_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Her name is taken from "the river located in Epirus, Greece":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acheron] which is said to be the branch of the underworld.

[spoilers]Her real name is revealed to be [b]Raiden Bosenmori Mei[/b].[/spoilers] Voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]] (JP) and [[Allegra Clark]] (EN). 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[hair intakes]] (and turn [[white hair|white]] upon using her ultimate), [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top]], [[white jacket|white]] [[flame print]] [[cropped jacket]], [[black belt]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], [[asymmetrical legwear]] ([[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots|thigh boot]] on her right and a black [[knee boots|knee boot]] on her left), and [[black gloves]]. She uses a [[katana]] as her main weapon.

Upon using her ultimate, her arms [[colored extremities|turn red]] and her gloves are replaced by [[red flower]]s.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7691435: Splash art

title: reu_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21030427
* !post #617587

Voice of [[Hakurei Reimu]] in the original [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆]]. Well known for her line "Puhaa~, Kyou mo ii tenki" ([i]Exhale[/i], today's weather is good too.), while holding her [[yunomi]]. Portrayed in either [[chiikorin]]'s or [[Huei Nazuki]]'s style with [[short hair with long locks|short]] [[brown hair]], [[red eyes]], and no frills on her hair bow. Often drawn [[plump]] and with [[large breasts]]. 

Got into voice acting by being friends with [[Uzuki (cookie)|]] in high school, later working with [[Alison (alison_airlines)|Alison Airlines]]. As one of the main characters of Cookie, she received a very large of both positive and negative attention. Unlike the others, she mostly accepted it and was more open with the fans about how [[Hazuna Rio]] treated her. Her weight led to many comments, with haters calling her a pig. Besides her Puhaa line, other jokes include her cosplays of [[Kagamine Rin]] being drawn as the swimsuit from [[Kagamine Len no Bousou (vocaloid)|]], and her obsession with longhorn [[beetle]]s.

She also led to three derivative characters:
* [[Sakenomi (cookie)|]]: "Kono sakenomi ga!" (You drunkard!). A chibi version of her drawn for a frame when addressing Suika. Since then has become a separate [[minigirl]] character.
* [[Reu Daikon]]: Reu's puhaa face on a [[daikon]]. Mostly a gag character, sometimes appearing with [[JOKER (cookie)|]]. Very popular in the Chinese Cookie fandom as a nudge for content to avoid the great firewall.
* [[Ru (cookie)|]]: a [[pixel art]] version that "made it to television":[https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm32824181]

title: nuppefuhofu
body:
ぬっぺふほふ  (also ぬっぺっぽう) 
A nuppefuhofu (also nuppeppou) is "a [[traditional youkai]] that is genderless and estimated to be up to 1.5m in height. It is described to have a flabby appearance and its appearance is accompanied by a pungent body odor. It appears as a blob of flesh with a hint of a face in the folds of fat. It is also described as having fingers and toes that are vaguely defined lumps. 

"The Nuppeppō is passive and unaggressive. The body odor is said to rival that smell of rotting flesh. Other theories claim that the Nuppeppō is actually decaying flesh. There is a rumor that states that those who eat the flesh of a Nuppeppō shall have eternal youth." [1]


h4. Links 

* [1] "Wikipedia (English)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuppepp%C5%8D 
* "Wikipedia (Japanese)":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%AC%E3%81%A3%E3%81%BA%E3%81%B5%E3%81%BB%E3%81%B5

body:

They are known for not revealing their real faces except to show them directly at live performances. Instead, they use their own unique anime character designs on the web. Sometimes they even perform with virtual 3D bodies, making them virtual YouTubers in a sense.

title: tarot
body:
An image featuring a [[tarot card|tarot card]], or drawn to look like a tarot card.

Tarot is a set of [[card]]s originally designed to be used as [[playing card]]s, but which was later adopted by occultists as a means of divination. A typical tarot deck consists of 78 cards, divided into two groups: the Minor Arcana and the Major Arcana.

The [[minor_arcana_(tarot)|Minor Arcana]] consists of 56 cards divided into four suits: swords, wands (batons), cups, and pentacles (coins). Each suit has ten numbered cards and four court cards: Kings, Queens, Knights, and Pages.

The Major Arcana, or trump cards, consists of 22 cards without suits:

* 0. [[The Fool (tarot)|]]†
* 1. [[The Magician (tarot)|]]
* 2. [[The High Priestess (tarot)|]]
* 3. [[The Empress (tarot)|]]
* 4. [[The Emperor (tarot)|]]
* 5. [[The Hierophant (tarot)|]]
* 6. [[The Lovers (tarot)|]]
* 7. [[The Chariot (tarot)|]]
* 8. [[Justice (tarot)|]] or [[Strength (tarot)|]]‡
* 9. [[The Hermit (tarot)|]]
* 10. [[Wheel of Fortune (tarot)|]]
* 11. [[Justice (tarot)|]] or [[Strength (tarot)|]]‡
* 12. [[The Hanged Man (tarot)|]]
* 13. [[Death (tarot)|]]
* 14. [[Temperance (tarot)|]]
* 15. [[The Devil (tarot)|]]
* 16. [[The Tower (tarot)|]]
* 17. [[The Star (tarot)|]]
* 18. [[The Moon (tarot)|]]
* 19. [[The Sun (tarot)|]]
* 20. [[Judgement (tarot)|]]
* 21. [[The World (tarot)|]]

† The Fool is unnumbered and not considered a trump card in traditional decks. It may be numbered 0 or 22 in decks designed for fortune-telling.
‡ In traditional decks, Justice is the 8th card and Strength is the 11th card. Starting in the early 20th century, they swapped positions in many fortune-telling decks.

h4. See also

* [[tarot (medium)]]
* [[tarot card]]
* [[tarot set]]
* [[card (medium)]]
* [[Tag group:Cards]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tarot":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tarot]

title: chongyue_(arknights)
body:
[i]Chongyue, self-proclaimed simple warrior visiting from Yan. (But no one's ever seen him in true action)[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]]. Real Name: [spoiler]Shuo[/spoiler]

The eldest of all Sui siblings. Previously a martial artist instructor at the Yanese nomadic city Yumen, he came to Rhodes Island to visit his family and stays onboard as a visitor.

One of the main characters in the side story [i]Where Vernal Winds Will Never Blow[/i].

His [[voice actor]]s are [[Seki Toshihiko]] (JP), Zhao Ling (CN-Mandarin), Jia Qiu (CN-Wuhanese), Yong Yea (EN), and Goo Ja-hyung (KR). His art designer is [[KuroBlood]].

title: mioto_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21092083
* !asset #21092118: MOTroid
* !asset #21092119: Useless

Voice of [[Tatara Kogasa]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Clownpiece☆]]. Arguably the best voice actress of the voice drama. Disappeared soon after the video was posted, then came back in late 2022, then declared she wanted nothing to do with Cookie and disappeared again in 2023.

The most popular character of Clownpiece☆, until [[Hisaka (cookie)|]]'s popularity boom in 2018 following "Henshin":[https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm33624864]. Her Nue-chan Shopping segment with [[Meimei (cookie)|]] is one of the most popular otoMAD remixes. In 2021 she even became the second Cookie character to become an [[UTAU]] called MOTroid after MGRoid. She has a few running jokes:

* "From now on, you can be a walking green coordinator!": Her most famous line when referring to the [[watering can]] she and Nue were advertising. "Green coordinator" is a wasei-eigo term for "interior foliage designer".
* Her [[heterochromia]] is sometimes the wrong way around
* Useless MOT: a joke half based on Kogasa herself being bad at scaring people and half on the drawing above
* She is sometimes shown with a trumpet similar to [[Mashiroma Zenima]]

title: namusanbou
body: Namusanbou is a Buddhist chant, meaning "Hail the Three Great Treasures of Buddhism!" As a catchphrase, namusan is commonly associated with [[Hijiri Byakuren]] from [[Touhou]], who says it before all her battles in [[Undefined Fantastic Object]], although it isn't necessarily limited to Touhou or Byakuren.

title: anon_tokyo_(bang_dream!)
body:
Usually stylized as [b]ANON TOKYO[/b], a fictional brandname used by [[Chihaya Anon]] whenever she needs to come up with a name for something. For example, it was one of her (rejected) suggestions for the name of the band [[MyGO!!!!! (bang dream!)|]].

Commonly included in both official media and fanart, either clearly visible or hidden as a sort of easter egg. Use this tag whenever the phrase is present in the image.

title: i-19_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine I-19. Nicknamed "Iku". Character design by [[Syobonne]], voiced by [[Misato (voice actor)|]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] in [[twintails]]/[[tri tails|triple-tails]], and [[red eyes]] with [[star-shaped pupils|]]. Her only outfit consists of a [[school swimsuit]] with a [[name tag]] on it. Other equipment includes her real-life 14 cm single gun mount on her right thigh and several torpedoes around her. 

She is very often seen holding her torpedoes in a way that it goes between her [[large breasts|breasts]], which are sizable for her frame. She also talks pretty lewdly; her nickname can literally mean "orgasm" and a few of her lines can easily be (mis)interpreted in a sexual meaning. 

h4. Appearance

title: i-26_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine I-26. Nicknamed "Nimu". Character design by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Ogura Yui]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] styled in a [[two side up]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default (and only) outfit consists of a [[new school swimsuit|1980s school swimsuit]] worn under a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[green jacket]] with [[white sailor collar]], [[two-tone_hairband|two-toned]] [[hairband]], and [[sandals]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of three hull pieces held to her by straps, containing her torpedoes, seaplane, and 14 cm gun mount. 

Her historical counterpart is responsible for dealing the fatal blow to the cruiser USS [i][[Juneau (Azur Lane)|]][/i] in Guadalcanal, which took the lives of the five Sullivan brothers that were serving on [i]Juneau[/i] when she sank. She disappeared without a trace on October 1944, presumably either sunk in a diving accident or during the battle of Leyte Gulf. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #2452308

title: i-41_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine I-41, drawn by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]]. Unlike most submarines in the game, she has never officially provided a goroawase nickname for herself, although I-36 does call her "Shi-chan" and she is also referred to as "Yoichi". 

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] tied to a [[short ponytail]], and [[black eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a blue [[school swimsuit]] worn under a [[white shirt|white]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[white sailor collar]], [[orange neckerchief]], and is [[barefoot]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life hull to her back, a 14 cm [[handgun]], [[hair ornament]]s, and a [[thigh pouch]] on her left leg. 

h4. Skins

title: i-58_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine I-58. Nicknamed "Goya". Character design by [[Syobonne]], voiced by [[Nakajima Megumi]].

She and [[i-168 (kancolle)|I-168]] share the same costume, consisting of a white and blue [[serafuku]] top with pink [[neckerchief]] [[swimsuit under clothes|over]] a classic blue [[school swimsuit]]. She has [[red_eyes|red]] or [[pink eyes]] and [[short_hair|short]] [[light brown hair]] or [[pink hair]] (depends on the artist), with a peculiar [[hair ornament]] consisting of a golden clip holding two sakura petals and two ribbons which appear to be connected to her [[ahoge]]. Like I-401, she [[barefoot|doesn't wear any shoes]]. 

The historical I-58 is most well known for sinking the heavy cruiser USS [[Indianapolis (azur lane)|]] on July 1945, soon after it delivered parts and uranium for the Little Boy atomic bomb. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #2082001

title: jowy_atreides-blight
body: [[Riou (suikoden)|]] and [[Nanami]]'s childhood friend in [[Gensou Suikoden II]]. Bearer of the Black Sword Rune, and over a series of events becomes Riou's enemy in the Dunan Unification War. How this conflict is resolved depends upon Riou's choices and if all 108 stars of destiny are recruited.

title: i-168_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine I-168. Nicknamed "Imuya". Character design by [[Syobonne]], voiced by [[Nakajima Megumi]].

She and [[i-58 (kancolle)|I-58]] share the same costume, consisting of a white and blue [[serafuku]] top with pink scarf over a classic blue [[school swimsuit]]. I-168 herself has [[long_hair|long]] [[red_hair|red]] or [[pink hair]], in a [[ponytail]] with a [[hair ribbon]] on a strand on her right side.

Originally named as I-68 before later renamed to I-168 a month before the [[Battle of Midway]]. She is best known for sinking the crippled aircraft carrier USS [[Yorktown (Azur Lane)|]] and the destroyer USS [[Hammann (azur lane)|]] in the battle. She was sunk by [[Scamp (kancolle)|]] on 27 July 1943 after a solo torpedo duel. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #2082006

h4. See also

* [[I-168 (Azur Lane)]] (her goroawase is "Iroha", though, through an alternate reading of the numbers 6 and 8)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: IJN I-168":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_submarine_I-168]

title: luc_(suikoden)
body: A magician who appears in [[gensou suikoden|Suikoden]] I, II and III. He is the bearer of the True Wind Rune and [[Leknaat]]'s apprentice. He rescues the child magician [[sarah (suikoden iii)|Sarah]] from Harmonia.
